Various techniques were used in this book to reproduce the original illustrations by Paul Avril, including heliogravure and chromotypographic processes.

caption: Foreign nave, looking west.—Zollverein and Belgian departments.
description:
Perspective view of the foreign nave at the Great Exhibition of 1851 in Crystal Palace, showing the statue of a lion and visitors sitting on benches in front of the Zollverein and Belgian departments.
The content of this book was first issued as weekly installments from October 4, 1851 to March 27, 1852.

caption: A mysterious business.
description:
People have stopped in the rain to look at a cello suspended above the street, hanging from the lighting wires.
The caption reads in the original French: Une mystérieuse affaire.

caption:
Rise up, Sir Oluf, and open the door—
On my forehead of white the damp dews pour.
description: A woman stands impatient in front of a closed door in the company of a heron and a dog.

caption:
The Elf King's daughter is featest of all:
She grips his reins with her fingers small.
description: A man on horseback leans over a fairy-like creature floating in front of him and wearing a dress which ends like a snake’s tail, while a tight group of similar creatures can be seen in the background, seemingly headed toward the woods.

caption: Tulip.
description:
A tulip is depicted as a woman wearing a turban and pearls hanging from her belt as bulb is dangling from her hands.
The caption reads in the original French: Tulipe.

caption: Evening at the subprefect's.
description:
A man sings with feeling at a polite society gathering where the women sit on chairs and the men stand behind them.
The caption reads in the original French: Soirée chez le sous-préfet.

caption: Sunflower.
description:
A sunflower is depicted as a kneeling male figure looking at the sky with his hands together while a female sunflower stands in the background with her arms folded across her chest.
The caption reads in the original French: Soleil.

caption: Narcissus .
description:
A narcissus is depicted as a woman standing on a river bank and looking at her reflection in the water under the eyes of a dragonfly and a salamander.
The caption reads in the original French: Narcisse.

caption:
The wind did blow, the cloak did fly,
Like streamer long and gay,
Till, loop and button failing both,
At last it flew away.
description: A man with two bottles hanging from his belt is riding a galloping horse. He has lost his hat and wig.

caption: Hemlock.
description:
Hemlock is depicted as a woman with an worried look on her face using a pestle and mortar as a frog lies dead at her feet, a hare in a toga drinks from a cup, and a rat vomits in the background.
The caption reads in the original French: Cigüe.

caption: The Turpinski Company getting ready.
description:
A circus company is getting ready for the coming performance, dressing and making up outside the wagons.
The caption reads in the original French: La toilette de la troupe Turpinski.

caption: Flying Heart Hotel.
description:
At night, a man leading a donkey by the bridle knocks on the door of a hotel standing in a narrow street, opposite a hosier’s shop.
The caption reads in the original French: L’hôtel du Cœur-Volant.

caption:
They doff their garb from head to heel;
Their white skins slip into skins of steel.
description: A prostrate woman is sitting on a stool clutching a sword as another stands behind her and combs her hair.

caption: Opium poppy.
description:
An opium poppy is depicted as a woman sprinkling poppy seeds from seedpods over beetles and grasshoppers while the only insect still awake lights its way with a lantern.
The caption reads in the original French: Pavot.

caption:
Each bottle had a curling ear
Through which the belt he drew
An hung a bottle on each side
To make his balance true.
description: A man stands in a room, fully dressed, with two bottles of wine hanging from his belt, his wife at his side, and a horse which can be seen through the open door at the back.

caption: Time opens the gates of Dawn.
description: An old man symbolizing time, with a scythe and an hourglass, can be seen from the shoulders up in the foreground while behind him the chariot of the dawn races across the sky.

caption: The kingdom of the Future.
description: An old man symbolizing Time stands at the end of a building supported by ionic columns while some children are engaged in dances and others look at the fire burning in the background. A predella-like addition below the main motif shows a city at night.

caption: The farewell of the lovers.
description: A girl and a young man looking like an ephebe are kissing as a ship ready to sail waits in the background.

caption:
John Gilpin was a citizen
Of credit and renown
A trainband captain eke was he
Of famous London town.
description: A man with a hat and holding a sword stands in front of three others as a tree can be seen in the background and a cannon on the left of the picture.

caption: Transformation of the Palace of Luxury.
description: Youths are dancing in a ring among the ruins of an antique building as a flock of birds flutters about them.

caption:
For saddle-tree scarce reached had he,
His journey to begin,
When, turning round his head, he saw
Three customers come in.
description: Three men with sticks are seen from the side walking in line down a path leading to a front door.

caption:
Now see him mounted once again,
Upon his nimble steed,
Full slowly pacing o'er the stones
With caution and good heed.
description: A smiling man with two bottles hanging from his belt faces the viewer while riding a horse which is off-picture, except for the ears and top of the head.

caption: The bird about to fly off from between the children's hands.
description: A boy and a girl in night dress are seen from the side facing each other and holding a bird in their hands.

caption: The children recount their adventures.
description: A boy and a girl are in a bedroom kneeling in front of a fireplace with their dog and looking into the fire, which lights up their faces.

caption: The attic.
description:
Illustration for a song, showing a man sitting on a bed in an attic room. He talks to a woman who is covering the window with what looks like a shawl. Additional motifs can be seen below and above the main illustration, showing a couple at a window, a man climbing up and down stairs, etc.
The original title of the song reads: Le genier.

caption:
John Gilpin's spouse said to her dear
"Though wedded we have been
These twice ten tedious years, yet we
No holiday have seen."
description: A man and a woman are seen from the side facing each other across a table.

caption: Half-title of Barrington.
description: Illustrated half-title of Barrington showing a woman riding a horse sidesaddle about to jump over a low wall.

caption: Design with god Pan.
description: Ornamental design showing the Greek god Pan with a staff, his panpipes, and a background of foliage. Title page decoration for The Great God Pan and the Inmost Light by Arthur Machen. Read more about Keynotes Series of Novels and Short Stories on this page.

caption: The accident.
description: A man supports and helps his tottering companion into a house where they are greeted by a third man holding a candlestick.

caption: The scholars of Lorbrulgrud.
description:
One of a group of three scholars with conspicuous headgear has picked up a tiny Gulliver from a table and holds him in his hand while examining him suspiciously.
The caption reads in the French edition: Les savants de Lordbruldrud [sic].

caption: Welcome to Barrington.
description: A crowd is cheering and gathering around a horse-drawn carriage in which two men are sitting.

caption: They all came smelling, and evidently took me for a brother Bruin.
description:
A large herd of crawling white bears covers an entire ice field, surrounding the one bear that stands erect, its front paws held up as though asking for attention.
The caption reads in the German edition: Sie kamen, einer nach dem andern, berochen mich und hielten mich augenscheinlich für einen Bruder Petz.

caption: He put several other questions to me, and still received rational answers.
description:
A tiny Gulliver stands upon a desk with an inkstand and answers the questions asked by the King of Brobdingnag.
The caption reads in the French edition: Je répondis avec justesse à toutes les questions du roi.

caption: Seizing our captain [...] in one of her claws, flew with him above a mile high.
description:
A bird looking like a large vulture is soaring with a man trapped in its claws as a group of people and a dismayed hatchling watch them fly away from the seashore.
The caption reads in the German edition: … Packte in eine seiner Klauen unsern Kapitän, flog eine Meile weit mit ihm in die Höhe.

caption: Poaching.
description: A man is up a ladder, his arm outstretched in an effort to take down a sign shaped as a fish hanging above his head, unaware of two men approaching with a smirk.

caption: The wager.
description: A woman rides a horse in a river as her hat falls off and men on horseback wave at her from the bank.

caption: Gulliver in Lorbrulgrud
description:
A tiny Gulliver stands on a street of Lorbrulgrud as a gigantic boy with a basket and his mother, carrying a tray on her head, pass him by.
The caption reads in the French edition: Gulliver à Lorbruldrud [sic].

caption: Gulliver and Glumdalclitch.
description:
A tiny Gulliver leans back against the arm of a gigantic young woman, herself reclining against a tree.
The caption reads in the French edition: Gulliver et Glumdalclitch.

caption: Paused for a moment to regard the sleeping children.
description: Two children are asleep in their bedroom as the back wall dissolves into to a dreamworld landscape with a ship sailing away in the moonlight and flocks of birds filling the sky.

caption: Ukobach.
description: Ukobach is a demon of a lower order usually depicted with a flaming body. He is said to be the inventor of fried food and fireworks. He is charged by Beelzebub to look after the oil in hell’s boilers.

caption: Behemoth.
description: Depiction of the demon Behemoth, described as slow  and stupid despite his rank. He reigns on gluttony and is sometimes thought to be cupbearer in hell.

caption: The dancing faun.
description: A faun is reclining on a meridienne, with a standard lamp being the only other visible piece of furniture. Title page illustration for The Dancing Faun by Florence farr. Read more about Keynotes Series of Novels and Short Stories on this page.

caption: The oak addresses the spirits of the trees.
description: A figure wearing a cloak and a long white beard has a child at his side and talks to a group of supernatural, half tree, half human creatures standing on the other side of a path in a forest of tall trees.

caption: Buer.
description: Depiction of Buer, described as a second-class demon and president of hell. He teaches philosophy, logic, and the properties of medicinal plants. He claims to provide good servants and cure the sick. He has fifty legions under his command.

caption: Give me your hand, little brother, I feel so frightened and so cold.
description: A boy and a girl are walking into the woods, leaving behind the faintly visible house where their parents are asleep.

caption: A depiction of Beelzebub.
description:
Beelzebub pictured as creature with a large eyeball with a hat on in ways of a head, enormous hands, and skinny legs.
The caption reads in the original French: Une des figures de Belzébuth.

caption: Title illustration for "Keynotes."
description:
Title page illustration for Keynotes, a collection of eight short stories by George Egerton. The picture shows a woman wearing a large hat and carrying a parasol, a Pierrot, and a jester-like figure playing the guitar.
Keynotes Series of Novels and Short Stories is a prospectus for the Keynotes Series, which consisted of thirty-four novels and short story collections written by mostly young authors and published by John Lane from 1893 onward. Each book was sold three shillings and six pence, an affordable price which matched the publisher’s aim to help these authors gain a readership. Beardsley created the cover design, which was also used as the title page illustration, for twenty-two of these books.

caption: The graveyard.
description: View of an imposing and grim architectural complex partly carved in rock with strikingly high cypress-like trees growing at its center. Headstones and slabs can be seen on a plaza in the foreground. The interior of a grave below the surface shows the resting bodies of a king and queen.

caption: I think I hear their voices in dispute.
description: Four women stoop near the door of a sitting room to listen to an argument taking place on the other side.

caption: Poor folk.
description: A woman with a bow in her hair is on a roof terrace, seen slightly from below from the opposite building. Title page illustration for Poor Folk by Fyodor Dostoyevsky. Read more about Keynotes Series of Novels and Short Stories on this page.

caption: Now and again ladies pass in their pattens, a maid perhaps protecting them with an umbrella, for flakes of snow are falling discreetly.
description: A woman walks smugly in the falling snow, protected by a young maid carrying an umbrella, as two other women watch her pass from behind a bow-window.

caption: Therefore I stood as near the centre as possible, for there was room enough for a dozen men in this creature's stomach.
description:
A man is coming alive out of the mouth of an enormous fish as men standing by watch in wonder.
The caption reads in the German edition: Daher stellte ich mich so viel möglich in die Mitte des Magens, worin für mehr als ein Dutzend Mann hinlänglich Platz war.

caption: You know how gallantly he swings his cane.
description: Two young women turn around as a dapper gentleman walks away in a side street at some distance behind them.

caption: Pueblo.
description: View of a pueblo with terraced structure and a semi-circular wall facing the viewer.

caption: Ornamental magnolia tree.
description: Floral design showing a magnolia tree stretching its branches and flowers toward the sky as its roots and rootlets bear hearts pointing downward. Title page decoration for Yellow and White, a collection of short stories by W. Carlton Dowe.  Read more about Keynotes Series of Novels and Short Stories on this page.

caption: Floral design with poppy.
description: Floral design showing a large (opium?) poppy flower surrounded by buds and leaves. Title page decoration for At the First Corner, a collection of nine short stories by H. B. Marriott Watson. Read more about Keynotes Series of Novels and Short Stories on this page.

caption: Muscle-splitting incision shown in preceding figure. This may be greatly enlarged by upward incision across muscle, parallel to nerves, as shown. This makes the so-called frying pan incision.
description: View of a surgical operation showing retractors keeping the muscle layer accessible as the surgeon inserts two fingers inside a muscle incision. The “preceding figure” referred to in the caption is that of the T-shaped incision.

caption: The Great Salt Lake.
description:
View of the shores of the Great Salt Lake, Utah, with a traveler walking along a path lined with jagged rocks in the foreground and a hilly island visible in the distance.
The caption reads in the original French: Le Grand Lac Salé.

caption: We are known everywhere now, Susan, you and I, as the old maids of Quality Street.
description: Two women are walking down a pleasantly broad and grass-grown street, protecting themselves from the sun with parasols.

caption: Floral Design with honeysuckle-like flowers.
description: Floral design showing two S-shaped stems bearing stylized honeysuckle-like flowers. Title page decoration for Mountain Lovers by Fiona Macleod (William Sharp). Read more about Keynotes Series of Novels and Short Stories on this page.

caption: It was raining, and my face was wet.
description: A woman and a man are walking together in the rain, protected by an umbrella, as the light of street lamps and windows can be seen in the background.

caption: Suspension of the kidney: introduction of the first suture. Note triangular suture in kidney on its posterior surface. This suture is placed with a delicate needle, the two free ends then carried with a coarse needle, as shown in figure, above the twelfth rib. This affords a high position to the suspended kidney.
description: Medical plate showing a surgical operation involving the incision of the muscle layer and the suturing of the kidney with two different needles.

caption: And the padding feet of many gnomes a-coming!
description: A crowd of gnomes in many shapes and colors is marching forward in the nightly forest.

caption: Oriental flying gurnard (Dactyloptena orientalis).
description:
Plate showing an Oriental flying gurnard (Dactyloptena orientalis), a fish in the family Dactylopteridae. It is found in the tropical waters of the Pacific Ocean where it feeds on other fishes, crustaceans, and mollusks.
The caption reads in the original French: Dactyloptère des Indes — Dactylpterus orientalis. nob.

caption: Wake, when some vile thing is near.
description: A human-looking male creature with butterfly wings hovers over a sleeping female of similar nature.

caption:
What form she pleased each thing would take
That e'er she did behold.
description: A young woman is sitting on a beach holding a jellyfish whose tentacles are made of jewelry.

caption: Baron Munchausen.
description: Imaginary bust of Baron Munchausen whimsically attributed to Antonio Canova and bearing the motto Mendace veritas (in falsehood, truth).

caption: painted comber (Serranus scriba).
description:
Ichthyological plate showing a painted comber (Serranus scriba), a marine fish in the family Serranidae. The painted comber lives near the bottom of the seas and oceans where it is found and feeds on crustaceans and other fishes.
The caption reads in the original French: Serran écriture — Serranus scriba. n.

caption:
For the nautilus is my boat
In which I over the waters float.
description: A fairy sits on the edge of a boat made of a nautilus shell floating on the open sea in the company of a squid-looking creature and a darting flying fish.

caption: Here would I have died infallibly, had not the strength of my arm pulled me out by my own braid, along with the horse, which I held firmly secured between my legs.
description:
A rider and his horse are suspended over a swamp, dripping with water, as the rider keeps pulling on his braid.
The caption reads in the German edition: Hier hätte ich unfehlbar umkommen müssen, wenn nicht die Stärke meines eigenen Armes mich an meinem eigenen Haarzopfe, samt dem Pferde, welches ich fest zwischen meine Knie schloß, wieder herausgezogen hätte.

caption: And I should look like a fountain of gold.
description: A mermaid is sitting at the bottom of the sea, combing her hair among seaweeds as a serpent cranes its neck in her direction.

caption: The head of the one stuck in the throat of the other! and they were struggling to extricate themselves!
description:
A crocodile is in the process of swallowing a lion stuck head first in its mouth while a man lying on the ground watches at some distance.
The caption reads in the German edition: Der Kopf des einen steckte nun in dem Schlunde des andern, und sie strebten mit aller Macht, sich voneinander loszumachen.

caption: Bighead searobin (Prionotus tribulus).
description:
Ichthyological plate showing a bighead searobin (Prionotus tribulus), a fish in the family Triglidae. It is found in the western Atlantic, where it commonly occurs over the mud-sand bottoms of bays and esturaries.
The caption reads in the original French: Prionaute chaussetrape — Prionotus tribulus. nob.

caption: Straighthead soldierfish (Ostichthys archiepiscopus).
description:
Plate showing a straighthead soldierfish (Ostichthys archiepiscopus), a fish in the family Holocentridae. Soldierfish can be found in tropical waters, where they display mostly nocturnal habits. They feed on zooplancton.
The caption reads in the original French: Myripristis du Japon — Myripristis japonicus. n.

caption: Natural hill.
description:
View of a cone-shaped mountain or hill topped with fir trees in the Tucumcari Valley.
The caption reads in the original French: Montagne-pyramide.

caption: Posterior view of lumbar region, showing superficial layer of muscles.
description: Medical plate showing a woman’s back with an annotated écorché view of the lumbar region displaying the muscle structure up to the lower shoulder blade area.

caption: A few steps ahead of him walked a poor woman in shabby clothes.
description:
A poorly clothed woman walks down a street, looking aware of the man with a hat and cane following her at a little distance, on the opposite pavement.
The caption reads in the original French: À quelques pas devant lui marchait une pauvre femme, vêtue misérablement.

caption: Left kidney in situ from the front. Through the retraction of the colon and omentum upward, and the small intestines to the right, the lower pole of kidney is exposed. It is, however, covered by mesocolon.
description: Medical plate showing a dissection view of the abdomen with the small intestine pulled to the viewer’s left, in order to make the location of the kidney visible.

caption: Pyramid Lake.
description:
View of Pyramid Lake, Nevada, showing the “pyramid” at its center and a hilly landscape in the background.
The caption reads in the original French: Lac de la pyramide.

caption: Wichita Mountains.
description:
View of a granite peak in the Wichita Mountains.
The caption reads in the original French: Monts Witchita [sic].

caption: I was with an old one-eyed woman, whom they call the Chouette (Screech-owl).
description:
An angry-looking old woman has grabbed the arm of a young girl carrying a tray held by a neck strap and pushes her forward on a bridge.
The caption reads in the original French: J’étais avec une vieille borgnesse qu’on appelait la Chouette.

caption: T-shaped incision. This gives abundance of room and is suitable when a large tumor of the kidney is to be dealt with. The perpendicular arm follows the linear semilunaris; the transverse is approximately parallel to the last rib. The incisions are carried through  all the layers of the abdomen down to the peritoneum.
description: Medical plate showing a woman’s torso bearing a large T-shaped surgical incision on the left side of abdomen.

caption: A blue hackney coach with blinds drawn down stopped at the entrance to the house.
description:
View of a busy street in the rain, with people coming and going, carrying packages and holding umbrellas.
The caption reads in the original French: Un petit fiacre bleu, à stores baissés, s’arrête devant chez nous.

caption:
Sea-nymphs hourly ring his knell:
Hark! now I here them,—ding-dong, bell.
description: Three nymphs pull on ropes which look like seaweed, in an underwater landscape where a wrecked ship can be seen outlined in the background.

caption: Natural cylinders.
description:
View of two approximately cylindrical granite formations at the western end of the Wichita Mountains.
The caption reads in the original French: Cylindres naturels.

caption: Dissection showing from the front the relations of the kidneys to the stomach, the pancreas, the duodenum and spleen. For the sake of clearness the stomach is represented as though transparent.
description: Medical plate showing an annotated dissection view of the internal organs of the abdomen.

caption: Instead of crust a peacock pie.
description: A fairy stands on a road lined with slender trees and works her magic to provide three beggars with peacock pie, a piece of venison, and lily flowers.

caption: A relic of San Griffone.
description: A man stands angrily holding up a pair of breeches in front of the bed where his wife sits naked.

caption:
The dun deer wooed with manner bland
And cowered beneath her lily hand.
description: A young woman wearing a veil and carrying a bunch of flowers walks in the woods followed by two deer.

caption: Chiara's indictment.
description: A monk gets seized and arrested in the cell of a monastery as a woman hides in bed beneath the sheets and a nun looks horrified.

caption:
Oh! they do get away down under ground,
In hollow pleazen where they can't be vound.
description: A fairy with brightly colored wings and antennas stands in front of a burrow opening below the roots of an old tree, surrounded by various Little Folk creatures.

caption: Marco the piper.
description: A man playing the bagpipes in a park is cheered and followed by a dancing crowd consisting mostly of young women.

caption: ... Crowded with painted and ragged drunkards, men and women, dancing and shouting till dawn. A man who was there told me. And as the day came they became aware of a fighting-machine standing near by the Langham and looking down at them.
description:
A small crowd is dancing and frolicking in the street, at night, by the light of a single storefront, as a towering robot-like figure watches from the darkness.
The caption reads in this Belgian edition:
… Où se pressa bientôt une multitude d’ivrognes en haillons, hommes et femmes, qui dansèrent et hurlèrent jusqu’à l’aurore. Quelqu’un qui s’y trouvait m’a conté la chose. Quand le jour parut, ils aperçurent une machine de combat marsienne [sic] qui, toute droite dans l’ombre, les observait avec curiosité.

caption:
Three spirits mad with joy
Come dashing down on a tall wayside flower.
description: Three fairy-like creatures are fluttering about long-stemmed flowers (carnations?).

caption: Down to the rocks where the serpents creep.
description: At the bottom of the sea, a man wearing a horned helmet and riding a rearing horse lifts a languid woman from the ground.

caption: The wife of Amalfitan.
description: A man is kneeling next to a woman sitting on a chair and embraces her.

caption: The dead rider.
description: A white horse standing in front of an ornate clustered column carries the slumped body of rider propped up by a lance which has been tied to his right hand and leg.

caption: And then the Martian beside us raised his tube on high and discharged it, gunwise, with a heavy report that made the ground heave. The one towards Staines answered him. There was no flash, no smoke, simply that loaded detonation.
description:
A tall robot-like figure with long stick legs holds what looks like a cannon above its head in a landscape lined with other similar figures.
The caption reads in the Belgian edition:
Alors, le marsien [sic] qui se trouvait le plus près de nous éleva son tube et le déchargea, à la manière d’un canon, avec un bruit sourd qui fit trembler le sol. Le marsien qui était près de Staines lui répondit. Il n’y eut ni flammes ni fumée, rien que cette lourde détonation.

caption: TOPSY-TURVY, upside down, bottom top.
description:
The letter T is illustrated with a youth in fancy dress smiling at the viewer while floating in a room seen upside down. The full verse reads:
Here’s Topsy-Turvy, upside down,
The ceiling seems the base:
Reverse the ground and ’twill be found
The things are out of place.

caption: Overwhelmed in an ocean of books.
description: A man is falling backwards among piles of books cascading over him.

caption: Wallpaper.
description:
Plate showing Wallpaper design with monkeys, parrots, and foliated design.
The caption reads in the original French: Papier peint.

caption: PETS, favourites, spoilt fondlings.
description:
The letter P is illustrated with a woman is sitting on a chair, spoon-feeding her monkey while surrounded by her other pets, among which a cockatoo, a cat, fishes, dogs, and a squirrel. The full verse reads:
Some people say that Aunty Gray
To animals is kind;
We think, instead, they are over fed,
And kept too much confined.

caption: Making her kneel down, I knighted her with my sword.
description: A woman is being knighted as a crowd of other women stands in the background and a few soldiers watch from the side.

caption: I caught them in my hands like so many pebbles.
description: A man on horseback has taken position before the walls of a fortress and is fired at with cannon-balls he catches in his bare hands.

caption: The arrival of the Martians.
description:
A tall machine-like figure with large round eyes and long threadlike legs brandishes a ray-gun in a ruined post-war urban landscape.
The title reads: Livre premier. — L’arrivée des marsiens [sic].

caption: They then tied us to stakes, and making great fires around us, began to dance in a circle.
description: Three men have been scalped and tied to burning stakes as native Americans dance around them.

caption: Ceramics.
description:
Plate showing a building with columns and arched architectural recesses decorated with different sorts of ceramic tiles.
The caption reads in the original French: Céramique.

caption: Printed fabrics.
description:
Plate showing samples of printed fabric with floral design.
The caption reads in the original French: Étoffe : Imprimée.

caption: Balcony.
description:
Plate showing Art Nouveau designs for balconies, the center one displaying distinctive plant-like decoration.
The caption reads in the original French: Balcon.

caption: CATASTROPHE, a final event (generally unhappy).
description:
The letter C is illustrated with a woman wearing a mobcap and mittens who discovers that the fish tank in her garden has just fallen from its base and got broken. The full verse reads:
“Oh here’s a sad catastrophe!”
Was Mrs. Blossom’s cry—
Then—”Water! water! bring to me—
Or all my fish will die.”

caption: She was ejected by the butler and the footman.
description:
A young woman with a hat puts up a mild struggle as she is thrown out of a house by servants.
This is an illustration for the story “The Noble Bachelor.”

caption: I looked to my side, but instead of a charming figure, what did I see?
description:
A man lies on the floor beside his bed with a monstrous creature standing tall over him.
The caption reads in the original French: Je jette les yeux à côté de moi ; au lieu d’une figure ravissante, que vois-je ?

caption: Headpiece with bat-like creature.
description: An ugly creature with bat wings, a fish-like head, and bony limbs is hanging on to a horizontal piece of wood, or bone, staring at the viewer with its bulging round eyes.

caption: ... Or Satan will keep ruling over the Earth.
description:
A human-shaped creature with bat wings, cleft feet, and a snake coiled around its body flies over Paris at night with a knife in its hand.
The caption reads in the original French: … Ou satan continuera de régner sur la terre.

caption: It's no use, John Clay.
description:
A man seizes another by the collar and stops him as he was about to escape down a secret passage.
This is an illustration for the story “The Red-Headed League.”

caption: ... The most striking phenomenons of nightmares.
description:
A winged monster is crouching on the chest of a sleeping man and looks at the viewer.
The caption reads in the original French: … Des phénomènes les plus frappants du cauchemar.

caption: The ghastly phantom […] replied to me: Che vuoi?
description:
A large and somewhat threatening camel’s head leans with a smirk over a man holding a candle and wearing a cocked hat.
The caption reads in the original French: L’odieux fantôme ouvre la gueul, et […] me répond : Che vuoi ?

caption:
Five hours (and who can do it less in?)
By Mr. Pink was spent in dressing.
description:
A man stands in the middle of a shabby and untidy room, dressing with great care.
The catalog record for this book attributes this series of illustrations to Isaac Robert Cruikshank, citing Gumuchian (the Parisian publisher?) as the only reference. Given that the same Gumuchian also mentions 1821 as the date of the first edition, whereas the book presented here bears 1819 as its publication date; given that the record describes these illustrations as wood engravings while we incline to believe they might well be etchings, we won’t be endorsing the Cruikshank attribution for the time being.

caption: He hurled the blacksmith over the parapet.
description:
A tall and strong man has picked up another and holds him in his arms like he would a child, ready to throw him over a stone parapet into the river below. In the background, a third man runs away from the scene.
This is an illustration for the story “The Speckled Band.”

caption: Good-night, Mr. Sherlock Holmes.
description:
Two men have reached their destination and stand on a doorstep at night, ready to unlock the door and go inside as a third one walks past them toward the viewer.
This is an illustration for the story “A Scandal in Bohemia.”

caption: Title page illustration of "The Dandy's Perambulations."
description:
A man rides a dandy horse on a country road.
The catalog record for this book attributes this series of illustrations to Isaac Robert Cruikshank, citing Gumuchian (the Parisian publisher?) as the only reference. Given that the same Gumuchian also mentions 1821 as the date of the first edition, whereas the book presented here bears 1819 as its publication date; given that the record describes these illustrations as wood engravings while we incline to believe they may well be etchings, we won’t be endorsing the Cruikshank attribution for the time being.

caption: He had your Brenta Valley house besieged with ghosts of his own making.
description:
A skeleton is draped in a hooded gown, leaving only its skull to be seen.
The caption reads in the original French: Il a fait assiéger par des fantômes de sa création votre maison de la Brenta.

caption:
... Where a coach had made a stop;
So they both got upon the top,
And after their disastrous falls,
At length in safety reach'd St. Paul's.
description:
A full-up coach with passengers sitting on the roof moves away from the viewer as the coachman whips the horses.
The catalog record for this book attributes this series of illustrations to Isaac Robert Cruikshank, citing Gumuchian (the Parisian publisher?) as the only reference. Given that the same Gumuchian also mentions 1821 as the date of the first edition, whereas the book presented here bears 1819 as its publication date; given that the record describes these illustrations as wood engravings while we incline to believe they might well be etchings, we won’t be endorsing the Cruikshank attribution for the time being.

caption: Iring staggered back half senseless.
description:
Two warriors in medieval attire are fighting each other among the flowers and leaves of an unrealistically large and decorative thistle.
The caption reads in the original German: Iring taumelte halb besinnungslos zurück.

caption: Invitation to the meeting of the World's Fair Committee for 1900.
description:
A man labeled “19th century” and looking like an ancient philosopher, with a long beard and a toga, is surrounded by the attributes of science and modernity as a young woman brings him a scale model of a city on a tray and the figures of the year 1900 glow on the horizon.
The caption reads in the original French: Invitation pour la réunion des jurys des expositions pour 1900.

caption: And then the distinguished guests moved forward.
description:
A boat carrying a woman and a man in armor follows that of a king and a queen. The king throws a piece of garment in the river as a city can be seen in the distance.
The caption reads in the original German: Als nun bald darauf die höhen Gäste herangefahren kamen.

caption:
Fork-tailed flycatcher
Gordonia lasianthus.
description:
A male fork-tailed flycatcher (Tyrannus savana) is seen on the branch of a blooming loblolly-bay tree (Gordonia lasianthus). The author offers the following anecdote about this bird:
In the end of June, 1832, I observed one of these birds a few miles below the city of Camden, New Jersey, flying over a meadow in pursuit of insects, after which it alighted on the top of a small detached tree, where I followed it and succeeded in obtaining it. The bird appeared to have lost itself: it was unsuspicious, and paid no attention to me as I approached it. While on the wing, it frequently employed its long tail, when performing sudden turns in following its prey, and when alighted, it vibrated it in the manner of the sparrow-hawk.

caption: Helias the Knight of the Swan.
description:
A boy sits on a rock by a pond and talks to the swans which have gathered close to him.
The caption reads in the original German: Helias der Schwanenritter.

caption: Snowy owl.
description:
A couple of snowy owls (Bubo scandiacus) are perched on the branches of a dead tree. The top one is a male, the bottom one a female. This bird is described as follows by the author:
The snowy owl hunts during the day, as well as in the dusk. Its flight is firm and protracted, although smooth and noiseless. It passes swiftly over its hunting ground, seizes its prey by instantaneously falling on it, and generally devours it on the spot. When the objects of its pursuit are on wing, such as ducks, grouse, or pigeons, it gains upon them by urging its speed, and strikes them somewhat in the manner of the Peregrine Falcon.

Two men are riding dandy horses on a country road.
The catalog record for this book attributes this series of illustrations to Isaac Robert Cruikshank, citing Gumuchian (the Parisian publisher?) as the only reference. Given that the same Gumuchian also mentions 1821 as the date of the first edition, whereas the book presented here bears 1819 as its publication date; given that the record describes these illustrations as wood engravings while we incline to believe they might well be etchings, we won’t be endorsing the Cruikshank attribution for the time being.

caption:
He tumbled o'er a poor old sow,
Who with her young made such a row,
That frighten'd Pink and Carey so,
They knew not then which way to go.
description:
Two men riding a dandy horse on a country road run into a sow and its piglets and fall over.
The catalog record for this book attributes this series of illustrations to Isaac Robert Cruikshank, citing Gumuchian (the Parisian publisher?) as the only reference. Given that the same Gumuchian also mentions 1821 as the date of the first edition, whereas the book presented here bears 1819 as its publication date; given that the record describes these illustrations as wood engravings while we incline to believe they might well be etchings, we won’t be endorsing the Cruikshank attribution for the time being.

caption:
So Carey took him up to ride
Upon his back, that he might guide
Their hobby, and return to town,
Intending there to set him down.
description:
A man rides a dandy horse on a country road, carrying a second man on his back.
The catalog record for this book attributes this series of illustrations to Isaac Robert Cruikshank, citing Gumuchian (the Parisian publisher?) as the only reference. Given that the same Gumuchian also mentions 1821 as the date of the first edition, whereas the book presented here bears 1819 as its publication date; given that the record describes these illustrations as wood engravings while we incline to believe they might well be etchings, we won’t be endorsing the Cruikshank attribution for the time being.

caption: Roland takes his leave of Hilda.
description:
A knight riding on horseback within the walls of a castle has stopped to talk to a woman standing on a terrace above him.
The caption reads in the original German: Rolands Abschied von Hilda.

caption: White-bellied swallow.
description:
A male and female tree swallows (Tachycineta bicolor) are seen in flight, one positioned upside down and seemingly feeding the other, whose belly is turned toward the viewer. This bird is listed as white-bellied swallow (Hirundo bicolor, Vieill.) by the author, who describes it as follows:
Its flight is easy, continued, and capable of being greatly protracted. It is seen sailing, circling, turning, and winding in all directions, during the greater part of the day. Like all other Swallows, it feeds on the wing, unceasingly pursuing insects of various kinds, and in seizing them producing a snapping noise, which may be heard at some distance.

caption: Wondrously high above, loomed Brunhilde’s castle.
description:
View of a castle overlooking a stormy lake, with its highest tower soaring into the sky.
The caption reads in the original German: Hochherrlich ragte Brünnhildens Schloß empor.

caption: His stallion reared up whinnying.
description:
A young man wearing a tunic trimmed with ermine fur and a feathered hat rides a rearing horse inside an ornamental frame decorated with an unrealistically large and ornamental thistle.
The caption reads in the original German: Sein Hengst bäumte sich wiehernd empor.

caption: Florigunde in the dragon’s den.
description:
A woman sits in a cave high in the mountains with a dragon at her feet.
The caption reads in the original German: Florigunde in der Drachenhöhle.

caption: It was an enormous dragon.
description:
A dragon comes flying over a castle overlooking a lake as a woman stands on a turret.
The caption reads in the original German: Es war ein ungeheurer drache.

caption: Umbrellas to mend!—any old ones to sell!
description:
A man stands in the rain on the street holding an open umbrella over his head, a folded one in his right hand, and having a bunch of them strapped on his back. The book offers the following information:
During the day the umbrella-mender goes his rounds, repeating these words, “Umbrellas to mend! Sixpence apiece for your old broken umbrellas!” and, having collected enough, he returns home to patch and mend, after which he or some of his family hawks them about for sale. Here he appears in his glory, under the auspices of St. Swithen, the patron saint of umbrella and patten-maker. It is the Strand, near Somerset House.

caption: ... And another tree, which bore plum-puddings.
description: A man sits on the ground of an imaginary landscape, eating with cutlery a large spherical fruit taken from a fantasy tree.

caption: At the ardent request of the whole empire, I condescended to be the president of the court.
description: A woman stands in court with the wigged justices sitting in line on two levels in the background, the president sitting alone at the top.

caption: The ghost of the Cape was discovered sitting squat in an excavation formed for him in the center of the mountain.
description: The bust of a monstrous, vaguely human-looking figure with large ears sticks out of the top of a volcano-like formation releasing fumes and smoke into the dark sky.

caption: Cats' meat!—dogs' meat!
description:
A man holding a large knife stands at a street corner in front a hand barrow surrounded by dogs. The book offers the following information:
The food for these domestic animals is sold about London from barrows or small carts, and consists generally of the flesh of horses. As the vendor approaches, the cats or dogs bound out at the well-known cry, often forming such a group as we have here, in Smithfield.

caption: Building the Forth Bridge.
description: View of one of the three cantilever structures of Forth Bridge being put up. Forth Bridge is a railway bridge over the Firth of Forth, Scotland. Its construction took place between 1882 and 1890.

caption: A big span on the African transcontinental telegraph line.
description: Two men have climbed up a ladder to the top of a telegraph pole overlooking a waterfall to secure it with wiring.

caption: These dreadful animals knowing, I presume, the force of our troop, advanced very slowly.
description: A man scatters powder on the edge of the circular ditch filled with water behind which he is entrenched as a group of threatening lions moves toward him.

caption: The old kingfisher lighted, and seizing our captain, [...] flew with him above a mile high.
description: A man is snatched up by a bird whose upper body can’t be seen and taken away from a fantasy land dotted with strange trees and mushrooms toward the sea.

caption: The Crumb Fairy.
description:
A group of people including women, children, and a man in a large hat and ruff are gathered around a table near a fireplace.
The caption reads in the original French: La fée aux miettes.

caption: Trilby.
description: A winged, angel-like figure snuggles up to a girl asleep in a chair next to a spinning wheel.

caption: Ines de Las Sierras.
description: A man kneels beside a woman dressed as a bride and kisses her arm as behind them a dinner table has been laid, on which two candles are burning.

caption: Smarra.
description:
A monster with lion’s paws, wings, a human face and hair made of snakes sits on the chest of a sleeping man as a woman stands beside them.
The following quote is from the story illustrated above:
Smarra est le nom primitif du mauvais esprit auquel les anciens rapportaient le triste phénomène du cauchemar.
Smarra is the primitive name of the malevolent spirit to which the Ancients attributed the sad phenomenon that is nightmare.

caption: Suddenly a monstrous eagle [...] carried me away seated on its shoulders
description: A man is seen from behind riding the back of a large eagle over a countryside landscape.

caption: The golden dream.
description:
A man with a casket in his hands is sitting on a shore in front of a tent as a young woman leaning on an oar stands in a boat next to him.
The caption reads in the original French: Le songe d’or.

caption: Building the pyramids.
description: a bunch of men is pulling on a rope, probably acting as a counterweight to lift a stone not visible in the picture, as a supervisor stands nearby holding a stick.

caption: I thought of examining the fruit.
description: A man cuts a large fruit hanging from a tree with his knife as a bird taller than him stands at his side.

caption: Frontispiece to "The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen."
description: Baron Munchausen is seen standing in profile leaning on a cane as a peacock spreads its tail in front of him. Lettering spelling the title and publisher is superimposed on the image in contrasting tones.

caption: Icebreaker at work.
description: View of a Russian icebreaker pushing through an ice field with the setting sun in the background.

caption: Baptiste Montauban
description: A young man in a hat points forward while speaking to a young woman going barefoot, as the sea can be seen in the background.

caption: Sindbad in the Valley of Diamonds.
description: A man stands in front of a gigantic bird’s leg and wraps a piece of linen around it while looking up.

caption: The giant tries to drink the stream.
description: A monstrous male figure is crouching on the bank of a stream, opening wide his bulging eyes and his mouth in an attempt to swallow as much as possible of the eddying water as fish can be seen jumping about.

caption: Waterfall on the Brionneau River.
description: View of a waterfall cascading into a pond surrounded by a water mill and various buildings.

caption: Rideau Canal.
description:
View of the Rideau Canal in Angers, France, as seen from the bank, with the city and the Trinité Church visible in the distance, and a wooden edifice—seemingly a wash house—built on the water.
The caption reads in the original French: Canal du Rideau.

caption: There was a great variety of tall, noble trees, loaded with marine fruit, such as lobsters, crabs, oysters…
description: A man rides a fantasy horse-like creature at the bottom of the sea in a rocky landscape populated by sea animals and imaginary monsters.

caption: The wounded dragon.
description: A dragon can be seen flying away across the starry sky, blood dripping from its head, as a hand wields the sword that wounded it from a castle window.

caption: Magnolia campbellii, H.f. & T.
description:
View of Magnolia campbellii flowers and bud on a branch.
Campbell’s magnolia is a tree in the family Magnoliaceae native to the Himalaya which is cultivated for its spectacular flowers.

caption: The legend of Sister Beatrix.
description:
A starved and exhausted young woman is reclining semi-unconscious on the lap of a nun sitting on a doorstep and holding a bowl of soup.
The caption reads in the original French: La légende de la sœur Béatrix.

caption: Place des arts.
description: View of a cobbled street leading to Place des Arts in Angers, France, with half-timbered houses and a few passers-by.

caption: He fortunately saved his life by laying hold of the tail of a large sea-gull.
description: A man is saved from drowning in a raging sea by catching hold of a seagull’s feathers as a ship can be seen in the distance.

caption: Androcles and the lion.
description: In a forest, a man wearing a toga kneels down to take a thorn out of a lion’s paw.

caption: Talauma hogsoni, H.f. & T.
description:
Botanical plate showing a branch of Magnolia hodgsonii bearing flowers and leaves, and bud and fruit on the side.
Magnolia hodgsonii is a tree in the family Magnoliaceae native to Asia.

caption: the King discovers the dead body of his son.
description: In a room lit by a lantern, two men wearing turbans stand before open curtains and look down at something we can’t see.

caption: It is to laugh.
description: A laughing jester wearing a mi-parti yellow and black costume has his hands crossed behind his head as his lower body is hidden by a sign that says “It is to laugh.”

caption: Penitents' entrance, Angers.
description:
View of a narrow, sloping street showing a convent façade with a turret and a gate with two oriel windows.
The caption reads in the original French: Entrée des Pénitentes.

caption:
Still towards Malepartus he went, and arriving, Sir Reynard he found
Sitting in front of his house.
description:
Tybert the cat carries a letter and bows obsequiously to Reynard who sits with his arms crossed and looks at him sternly.
The caption reads in the original German:
Immer wandert’ er fort nach Malepartus, da fand er
Vor dem Hause Reineken sitzen.
The translation provided here is by John Storer Cobb.

caption:
To his bed was your father confined,
In winter, in exquisite pain, nigh greater than he could endure.
description:
The king lies in bed in agony, surrounded by doctors and grieving courtiers as a cook brings a dish from the kitchen in the background.
The caption reads in the original German:
Es legte sich damals
Euer Vater im Winter mit großen Schmerzen zu Bette.
The translation provided here is by John Storer Cobb.

caption: The awful bugaboo.
description:
A smiling and disheveled creature with a tail ending like an arrowhead rides a broom. The full verse reads:
There was an awful bugaboo
Whose eyes were red and hair was blue;
His teeth were long and sharp and white
And he went proling ’round at night.

caption: Angers, Filles-Dieu Crossroads.
description:
View of a snowy street with children playing and a building with a polygonal staircase tower.
The caption reads in the original French: Carrefour des Filles-Dieu.

caption:
All the little boys and girls [...]
Tripping and skipping ran merrily after
The wonderful music with shouting and laughter.
description: A man in a robe and hat plays the pipe and takes along with him a group of cheering and dancing children.

caption: Hôtel de Pincé.
description:
View of the Hôtel de Pincé, also known as Logis Pincé, a sixteenth-century townhouse located in Angers.
The caption reads in the original French: L’hôtel du Figuier (dit d’Anjou).

caption: How their children were stolen away.
description: View of an orchard filled with children dressed in white, some of which are dancing around a tree in full bloom, while a man in a red robe and hat sits playing the pipe.

caption: A nip, a grip, and then a pang.
description:
A man in a top hat runs and jumps as he is chased and caught by the tail of his black jacket by a small bulldog. The full verse reads:
The lute gave forth a plaintive twang—
Oh, how that doting lover sang!
A bulldog with invidious fang—
A nip, a grip, and then a pang.

caption: Weird and Woful [sic].
description: A pudgy boy with a lock of hair sticking out, and wearing a polka-dotted shirt is crying.

caption: In a given circle to inscribe a square.
description: Page of a geometry textbook on Euclid’s Elements book IV, proposition 6 illustrated with diagrams showing geometric shapes in various colors.

caption: ... And even spoiled the women’s chats.
description: Rats run away through the open door of a house startling two women outside, one of which has climbed onto an overturned wooden bucket with her child under her arm.

caption: If a straight line be bisected and produced to any point, the rectangle contained by the whole line so increased, and the part produced, together with the square of half the line, is equal to the square of the line made up of the half, and the produced part .
description: Page of a geometry textbook showing Euclid’s Elements book II, proposition 6 illustrated with rectangles and lines of various colors.

caption: Tailpiece with cocky fantasy figure. Canto nine.
description: A fantasy figure with a beard divided in two twisted parts which end in decorative volutes cocks a snook at the viewer.

caption: Adam's house, Angers.
description:
View of an elaborate, tall, two-gabled, timber-framed building embellished with wreathed wooden columns and decorative basket-handle arches. On the first floor, a shop bears the sign Magasin de deuil (bereavement clothing).
The caption reads in the original French: La maison d’Adam.

caption: Surroundings of Trinity Church.
description:
Street view around Trinity Church in Angers, France, showing the choir and the tower as well as the shops backed onto the church walls.
The caption reads in the original French: Abords de la Trinité.

caption: He laid his long pipe of smooth straight cane; and ere he blew three notes…
description: A man in a red robe and hat stands on the market place and plays the pipe before the food stalls and drawing children to the sound of his music.

caption: Out of the houses the rats came tumbling.
description: A woman carrying a basket watches as a piper wearing a robe and a pointed hat leads a swarm of rats away from a medieval city, followed at some distance by a colorful crowd.

caption: A thousand Guilders! The mayor looked blue.
description: A man in a robe and a soft pointy hat faces a group of condescending city dignitaries wearing brightly colored coats trimmed with fur.

caption: Tannery Bridge, Angers.
description:
View of an arched bridge stretching over a stream with half-timbered houses on each side. A fisherman stands near the water, facing washerwomen on the other bank.
The caption reads in the original French: Pont des tanneries.

caption: The museum staircase.
description:
View of a spiral staircase topped by spectacular palm vaulting in the Logis Barrault, a building dating back to the late fifteenth century now housing the museum of fine arts of Angers. A Gothic parapet can also be seen on the top landing.
The caption reads in the original French: Escalier du musée.

caption: Like fowls in a farmyard when barley is scattering.
description: Children are rushing out of a building entrance and run down the road, turning their backs to the viewer, before they disappear behind a corner.

caption: Swans with entwined necks. Canto three.
description: Two swans with entwined necks sit on a stem decorated with volutes and a garland of hatching eggs.

caption: Two-color initial S with foliated design.
description:
Decorative initial S with foliated design on blueish-gray background and orange border.
Opening letter for the ode “To Vertue” by George Herbert.

caption: Foul weather.
description:
A young woman wearing a light dress and holding an umbrella stands looking down at a puddle into which leaves are falling.
The caption reads in the original French: Chien de temps.

caption: Frontispiece of "The English Dance of Death."
description: A crowned skeleton symbolizing Death sits pensively on a globe, holding an arrow. An hourglass stands between his feet while on the ground various objects lay scattered, among which an open book displaying the title “Death’s Dance”, guns, a dagger, poisons and drugs, and a powder keg.

caption:
At this Reynard said to the hare: To the others again you may go,
Among them resuming your place; enough to the king you have told.
description:
A bashful and more than a little impressed hare is taken by Reynard to the King who sits in majesty on his throne, the Queen at his side.
The caption reads in the original German:
Reineke sagte darauf: Ihr könnt Euch unter die andern
Wieder stellen; Ihr habet den König genugsam berichtet.
The translation provided here is by John Storer Cobb.

caption: Headpiece with female figure and musician fauns. Canto one.
description: A female figure naked from the waist up holds a lyre in each hand, which two fauns seem eager to take hold of. At her sides, which extend into rinceaux in both directions, two other fauns play the panpipes and an aulos-like double flute.

caption:
The dangers of the ocean oer,
Death wrecks the sailors on the shore.
description: Two castaways mope on a rocky shore as Death in the guise of a skeleton sits on a rock opposite them and the last of their ship disappears into the sea.

caption:
To me the announcement he made that he a good monk had become,
Had taken the solemnest vow atonement to make for his crimes.
description:
Reynard has entered a henhouse dressed as a monk and looks humble and steeped in piety as a rooster standing on an overturned basket looks closely at his credentials.
The caption reads in the original German:
Und er zeigte mir an: er sei ein Klausner geworden,
Habe strenge Gelübde getan, die Sünden zu büßen.
The translation provided here is by John Storer Cobb.

caption: Two-Color headpiece with circular floral design.
description:
Ornamental headpiece showing floral motifs enclosed in circular borders with a blueish-gray background.
Decoration for the sonnet “From You Have I Been Absent in the Spring…” by William Shakespeare.

caption: He cut at me.
description:
A man hanging outside a window clings to the windowsill with one hand as another man standing inside the building wields a meat cleaver.
Illustration for the story “The Engineer’s Thumb.”

caption: It was something wonderful!
description:
A group of people is gathered at night around a campfire in the woods as a man on horseback approaches in the background.
The caption reads in the original French: C’était quelque chose d’admirable !

caption: I rushed to the door.
description:
A man is trapped in a lamplit underground room and vainly tries to open the door.
Illustration for the story “The Engineer’s Thumb.”

caption:
Up jumped the good priest with a scream, and after me tried to pursue,
And the table knocked over with all that was on it to eat and to drink.
description:
Reynard the Fox runs away from a house with a stolen dish of poultry, cheekily turning around to mock his victim who knocks a table over trying to pursue him as the housekeeper throws her arms up in anger and alarm.
The caption reads in the original German:
Hastig wollte der Pfaffe mir nach und lärmte, da stieß er
Über den Haufen den Tisch mit Speisen und allem Getränke.
The translation provided here is by John Storer Cobb.

caption: Press for molding goblets.
description: View of a workshop where two men are busy around a mobile press and a third one holds a rod in a furnace in the background.

caption: Is there anything more irritating than an Italian greyhound wearing a jacket?
description:
A young woman carrying a guitar on her back stands in the rain wearing a thin loose dress and no shoes. She looks at an Italian greyhound with a jacket which prances at her feet.
The caption reads in the original French: Y’a-t-il rien qui vous agace comme une levrette en paletot.

caption:
My care was now centered on this: to search and discover the spot
Wherein was the treasure concealed, and stealthily take it away.
description:
A fox spies on another who comes out of an arched door opening beneath a tree with two vases in his arms, one of which is filled jewels.
The caption reads in the original German:
Meine Sorge ging nun dahin, den Ort zu entdecken,
Wo der Schatz sich befände, damit ich ihn heimlich entführte.
The translation provided here is by John Storer Cobb.

caption: "Hurrah!" he cried.
description:
A man hunting capercaillies with hooks and cords has struck three of them and enthusiastically steps forward to secure his catch as a few birds manage to dash away.
The caption reads in the original French: ‘Hurra !’ s’écria-t-il.

caption: Hauling cotton to market.
description:
A team of four horses pulls a cart filled up with cotton bales and driven by a man riding one of them.
The faint horizontal and vertical white lines crossing the picture through the middle show how woodblocks were sometimes cut down into pieces to allow several engravers to work on the same illustration, thus speeding up the engraving process. The pieces were then glued back together before some finishing touches were applied.

caption: Setting up the watches.
description: View of the workshop of a watch factory where men are busy at work, sitting on chairs lining the workbench.

caption: A number to pity were moved.
description:
Reynard is on a ladder about to be hanged. A cat sits on the tree trunk, securing the noose to a branch as below a crowd has gathered to witness the ceremony. Among them, the King and the Queen look particularly moved and grief-stricken.
The caption in the original language reads: Viele jammerte das.
The translation provided here is by John Storer Cobb.

caption: A drama on a seat.
description:
A coach is seen from above, as though from the window of a building, while the driver is having a heated argument with a passenger leaning out of the window and raises his whip. A woman pokes her head out of the window on the other side, seemingly calling for help toward a man standing in the middle of the street who doesn’t seem to be interested.
The caption in the original language reads: “Un drame sur un siège.”

caption:
Our monarch has taken an oath that now at the bar of his court
Yourself you shall place upon trial, and I am your escort to be.
description:
A bear wearing a morion and carrying a halberd knocks on Reynard’s door, who peeks warily out the window.
The caption reads in the original German:
Denn es hat der König geschworen, Ihr sollet bei Hofe
Vor Gericht Euch stellen, ich soll Euch holen, damit Ihr.
The translation provided here is by John Storer Cobb.

caption: The validated sultana.
description:
A skull with missing front teeth wears a hat and smokes a cigarette.
The caption reads in the original French: La sultane validée.

caption: Illustrated title page of "Reineke Fuchs" (Reynard the Fox)
description: Illustrated title page of Reineke Fuchs (Reynard the Fox) showing monkeys playing the violin and blowing trumpets, the symbolic attributes of Art and the engraving craft, and a jester standing on one leg with an owl on one hand and a mirror facing the viewer in the other, while two foxes are trying to get his attention. A griffin sits looking away on either side of the page.

caption: When Puss saw the rats and mice, she didn’t wait to be told.
description:
A North African party where people sit on cushions around tea, lobster, and fruit is disturbed by a multitude of rodents after which a cat heartily sets out.
Illustration for “Dick Whittington and His Cat.”

caption: Two-color initial H with floral design.
description:
Ornamental initial H with curved and descending leg, blueish-gray background decorated with floral design, and orange border.
Opening letter for the ode “To the Cuckoo” by John Logan.

caption: Tall trees, green arbours, and ground flowers in flocks.
description:
Woodland view with an old tree overlooking a pond in late spring or early summer.
Illustration for the poem “How Sweet It Is When Mother Fancy Rocks…” by William Wordsworth.

caption: Two-color lozenge-shaped ornament with floral and foliage design.
description:
Lozenge-shaped ornament with blueish-gray background, floral and foliage design, and orange border.
Decoration used as a tailpiece for the sonnet “From You Have I Been Absent in the Spring…” by William Shakespeare.

caption: Go gallant ship, and be thy fortune fair!
description:
A ship sails toward the open sea, leaving behind the rocky shore and a lighthouse on a promontory.
Illustration for the poem “Stately Yon Vessel” by Robert Southey.

caption: Tailpiece with mosquitoes. Canto eight.
description: Two bodiless male faces in profile view look in opposite directions, each one falling prey of a cloud of mosquitoes going for the nose. Tailpiece for canto eight.

caption: Two-color tailpiece with flower garland.
description:
Ornamental tailpiece with sinuous garland showing foliage and blossoms against a blueish-gray background and a subdued orange border.
Decoration for the ode “To Peace” by William Cowper.

caption: Two-color headpiece with floral design.
description:
Ornamental headpiece with floral design, blueish-gray background, and subdued orange border.
Decoration for the poem “It Is a Beauteous Evening” by William Wordsworth.

caption: Two-color initial W with foliated design.
description:
Ornamental initial W with foliated design on blueish-gray background and orange border.
Opening letter for the ode “When May Is in His Prime” by Richard Edwards.

caption: “Well!” she chuckled, “I am in luck!”
description:
A smiling woman stands at the gate of her house as a strange large furry animal looking like a crossbreed between a fox and a rodent seems to suddenly appear behind her in an uncanny sort of way.
Illustration for “The Bogey-Beast.”

caption: Tattercoats dancing while the gooseherd pipes.
description:
A girl in patched, ragged clothes dances on the bank of a pond to the music of a young gooseherd who sits at the foot of a tree playing the flute.
Illustration for “Tattercoats.”

caption: Fee-fi-fo-fum, I smell the blood of an Englishman.
description:
A giant in a fur tunic and hat looks inquisitively around a kitchen too low for him to stand up straight as the woman interrupted in her cooking duties wears a dismayed look on her face.
Illustration for “Jack and the Beanstalk.”

caption: The colonists were in the boat.
description:
A group of men explores a sea cave in a rowboat, lighting the way with a lantern.
The caption reads in the original French: Les colons étaient dans le canot.

caption: They met near the gondola.
description:
People are busy around a hot air balloon tethered on a city square and straining on its ropes.
The caption reads in the original French: Ils se rencontrèrent près de la nacelle.

caption: They thanked her and said good-bye, and she went on her journey.
description:
A young woman stands at the edge of a well built at ground level, talking to three heads floating in the water as brambles can be seen in the background.
Illustration for “The Three Heads of the Well.”

caption: Thoughts, Traveller, of thee, will fill my head.
description:
A man with a stick walks against the wind, seemingly struggling, in a snowy landscape.
Illustration for the poem “The Winter Traveller” by Henry Kirke White.

caption: He seized the jaguar by the throat.
description:
A man fights a pouncing jaguar with a knife.
The caption reads in the original French: Il avait saisi le jaguar à la gorge.

caption: Pencroff untied his arms.
description:
Three men are gathered around an orang-outang at the entrance of a cave.
The caption reads in the original French: Pencroff avait délié ses bras.

caption: Tree of mine! O tree of mine! Have you seen my naughty little maid.
description:
A witch straddling her broom addresses a tree with human-like face and arms, failing to notice the girl hiding in the blossoms.
Illustration for “The Two Sisters.”

caption: Taking the keys of the castle, Jack unlocked all the doors.
description:
A boy carrying a bunch of large keys has entered a gate and walks into a room where three women are kept prisoners and tied by their hair to hooks sticking out of the wall. Two giants can be seen outside the gate, unable to interfere.
Illustration for “Jack the Giant-Killer.”

caption: She went along, and went along, and went along.
description:
A girl wearing a fur hat and a crude coat made of cat’s hides stands in a landscape of woodland and hills with a bundle of clothes in her hand.
Illustration for “Catskin.”

caption: Headpiece with dancing animals. Canto seven.
description: A cat has joined a bear and a female wolf dancing together to the music of a monkey and a boy playing the shawm. Headpiece for canto seven.

caption:
There festively sported itself the grandest assemby by far,
That ever together was brought...
description:
A wild dinner party is taking place, where animals can be seen kissing, eating greedily, dancing, and getting drunk.
The caption reads in the original German:
Da ergötzte sich festlich die beste Gesellschaft, die jemals
Nur beisammen gewesen…
The translation provided here is by John Storer Cobb.

caption: The deep-voiced thunders roll, awful and loud.
description:
View of a mountainous landscape in stormy weather with a lake, a sparse few trees growing on the bank, and a tiny human figure kneeling on a rock.
Illustration for the sonnet “How Darkly o’er Yon Far-Off Mountain Frowns…” by Robert Southey.

caption: The colonists even explored dark tunnels…
description:
A group of men stands at the entrance of a rocky tunnel. One of them has climbed onto a large rock lying on the ground and holds a torch high above his head,  peering into the depths ahead of him.
The caption reads in the original French: Les colons visitèrent même de sombres tunnels…

caption: He breathed, and heaving himself up to the chains…
description:
A man pulls himself up from the water using the chains of the ship he intends to board surreptitiously.
The caption reads in the original French: Il respira, et, se haussant sur les chaînes…

caption: Cooling breezes shake the reed.
description:
A couple stands on the bank of a stream flowing in a wooded landscape and looks at the moon through the trees.
Illustration for the poem “Evening Ode” by Samuel Johnson.

caption: "What are you doing here?" said Bob Harvey.
description:
On a ship, a man naked from the waist up and carrying a gun is stopped by the captain holding up a lantern to his face.
The caption reads in the original French: ‘Que fais-tu là ?’ dit Bob Harvey.

caption: Pencroff ran immediately to his wheat field.
description:
A man wearing a hat and carrying a canvas cover rolled up under his arm walks against the wind in a hail storm.
The caption reads in the original French: Aussitôt, Pencroff courut à son champ de blé.

caption:
William Wilson
A masquerade in the palazzo of the Neapolitan Duke di Broglio.
description: At a crowded masquerade ball, a pierrot bends down in the foreground  to pick up something (a glove?) from the floor as two figures wearing identical costumes and masks move toward the viewer.

caption: Jup used to spend some of his time in the kitchen.
description:
An orang-outang wearing a shirt and an apron stands in a makeshift kitchen and looks at its reflection on the bottom of a saucepan.
The caption reads in the original French: Jup passait une partie de son temps à la cuisine.

caption:
The assignation
Thou hast conquered—one hour after sunrise—we shall meet—so let it be!
description: A man in a (wet) black suit and a woman in a white gown are holding hands at the foot of stairs leading to a Venetian canal where a gondola is moored in the foreground.

caption:
The facts in the case of M. Valdemar
Yes;—No;—I have been sleeping—and now—now—I am dead.
description: Visitors are gathered around a bed where somebody is lying. One of the men faints and falls back into the arms of another as all those present stare in astonishment toward the head of the bed, which is hidden from the viewer by a curtain.

caption:
Ms. Found in a Bottle
Upon the very verge of the precipitous descent hovered a gigantic ship.
description: A ship sails on the crest of an enormous wave about to break in a twilight atmosphere.

caption: And now the Sun comes forth with level ray.
description:
View of an open landscape with a river hemmed in by steep banks and hills on the horizon.
Illustration for the poem “The Return” by John Codrington Bampfylde.

caption:
The fall of the house of Usher
Madman! I tell you that she now stands without the door!
description: A woman stands clutching her head in a sitting room, next to a man reading at a table. They both look at the ajar door.

caption:
Rub, rub, rub!
Now the mittens are clean.
description: A kitten spills water from a bucket on another while a third one hangs laundry to dry.

caption:
Eleonora
A magic prison-house of grandeur and of glory.
description: A young man embraces the woman standing before him on a riverbank covered with colorful flowers, as though inviting her for a dance. Flamingos can be seen wading by the riverside and soaring in the background.

caption: One, two, three kittens.
description: Three kittens, drawn in mostly inverted tones, hold hands while facing the viewer, the center one dressed as a boy, the ones one each side dressed as girls.

caption: "Come!" exclaimed Niclausse, "come on here!"
description:
A man riding a bottle floats in mid-air and pulls a man standing on a balcony by his lapel in an attempt to make him follow along.
The caption reads in the original French: Allons ! s’écria Niclausse, arrive !

caption: It turned Honech mad.
description:
A medieval castle can be seen burning in the night as a man sits looking forlorn and exhausted in the foreground.
The caption reads in the original French: Honech en devint fou.

caption: Now, we will come down stairs.
description: Three kittens are walking down a flight of stairs, one behind the other.

caption:
Hear what I say, little kittens.
Try not to spoil your mittens.
description: Three kittens come running to their mother who stands in the dining room.

caption: The Colonel stood by, looking gravely through his glasses.
description:
In a somewhat untidy artist’s studio, a woman holds a print she took from a portfolio and shows it to the attentive man standing behind her.
This picture is an illustration for Mrs. Dymond , by Anne Thackeray Ritchie.

caption: He was the last of the Burckars.
description:
A human figure with animal-like features, such as clawed feet, furry legs, and wolf’s ears tries to fight off with a large branch the hounds chasing him.
The caption reads in the original French: C’était le dernier Burckar.

caption: The question is: do you like me?
description:
A young woman and a man with his hands in the pockets of his jacket stand by the riverside at night, he looking at her and she turning her gaze down to the water.
This picture is an illustration for Within the Precincts, by Mrs. Oliphant.

caption: Till Friday.
description:
A thoughtful young woman stands in a landscape filled with leafless trees and lets her hand rest lightly on a low wall.
This picture is an illustration for Within the Precincts, by Mrs. Oliphant.

caption: O, where are our mittens?
description: A mother cat stands behind her three crying kittens in a dining room where a large pie can be seen on the table.

caption:
The spectacles
I amused myself by observing the audience.
description: Two men are seen from behind sitting in a box at the theater and looking at the audience in the orchestra.

caption: The path to the moon.
description: A rocky path meanders forward into the void until it reaches the moon, which stands out against a star-studded sky.

caption: Loneliness.
description: A tree stands on a riverbank silhouetted against the sky as the setting sun can be seen disappearing behind a slope.

caption: All thy waves are gone over me.
description: A human-like figure (an angel? Icarus?) floats on the sea, with only the head and two large wings sticking out of the water.

caption:
Metzengerstein
A cloud of smoke settled heavily over the battlements in the distinct colossal figure of—a horse.
description: A castle standing atop a hill is ablaze and from the high-rising flames the figure of a horse can be seen taking shape against the night sky.

caption: the gap.
description: Two cliffs, each ending in a rocky peak, stand next to each other, seemingly almost touching at one point, but the chasm between them widening on the way down.

caption: Mammon.
description: A man of gigantic proportions points his finger at the viewer while standing behind mountains which overlook a city with many spires.

caption:
The pit and the pendulum
They swarmed upon me in ever-accumulating heaps.
description: A man is tied down to a plank on the floor as countless rats come swarming on him and a sharp ax-like blade swings over his head.

caption: The viaduct.
description: View of a steam train crossing a viaduct and moving away from a hill lined with crooked chimneys.

caption: “You know my weakness,” said the signor, stiffly.
description:
A man sitting at a piano with a music book open before him turns to his right to look at a woman holding a pince-nez.
This picture is an illustration for Within the Precincts, by Mrs. Oliphant.

caption: Mr. Furbach saw the countless thatched houses below...
description:
View of the façade of a somewhat run-down castle and a side street going up with a man leaning over the parapet and another pulling a cart.
The caption reads in the original French: M. Furbach vit au-dessous les chaumières innombrables…

caption: Zacharias stood watch behind the door.
description:
A man who stands behind a door while keeping it ajar hides a gun behind his back as a raven is perched above him.
The caption reads in the original French: Zacharias se mit en faction derrière la porte.

caption: He and the old woman swinged it for a moment.
description:
Two people stand on the edge of a cliff at night after dropping a bag containing—among other things—a bed sheet which can be seen floating between the rocks.
The caption reads in the original French: La vieille et lui le balancèrent un instant…

caption: The Count, in his shirt, standing on that window...
description:
A man in a nightshirt stands on a windowsill holding a torch and gesturing toward the night sky.
The caption reads in the original French: Le comte, en chemise, debout sur cette fenêtre…

caption: Neurographie [sic].
description: Anatomical plate showing the nervous system with detail views of the brain, spine, bust, etc.

caption: Over!
description: A horse and his rider are seen jumping a wooden fence.

caption: Facey Romford treats Sponge to a little music.
description: A man stands playing the flute to another sitting in front of a fireplace.

caption:
Recapitulation
Myography. — Neurography. — Angeography [sic].
description: Anatomical plate offering an overall view of the muscle structure, the blood circulatory system, and the nervous system in the human body.

caption: Mister Sponge completely scatters His Lordship.
description: At a fox hunting meet, a man has fallen from his horse and tries to get back to his feet as hounds are running around and a horse rears up behind him.

caption: Here is the one who is due to come back to comfort and forgive...
description:
Two men stand in the vaulted archive room of a castle, looking at portraits on the wall by torchlight.
