A man in fancy dress stands with his hands on his hips ready for the costume ball.
The caption reads in the original French: Général étranger.

caption: Mr. Floumann.
description: A winking man wearing a bicorne and a tailcoat stretches out one arm as part of a dancing pose.

caption: Say! this cheat at the junk shop wanted to take back my Souvenirs and my Regrets at four pounds and ten sous... Old skinflint!
description:
A woman hammers a hook in a wall while a friend of hers leans over a painting on the floor. This illustration is from the series “Les lorettes.”
The caption reads in the original French: Dis donc ! Ce voleur de bric-à-brac qui voulait reprendre mes Souvenirs et mes Regrets pour quatre livres dix sous… Vieux Mardochée !

caption: Islander from anywhere.
description:
A bespectacled man with long tousled hair wears a cape and has a mannequin’s head hanging from his belt as though to mimic headhunters’ perceived customs. His hand half-covering his mouth and his expression suggest he his thinking deeply.
The caption reads in the original French: Insulaire de n’importe où.

caption: Minon-Minard.
description: A man wearing boots, tight pants, a loose shirt, and a cavalry helmet sings with his arms raised at shoulder-height.

caption:
Act 2, scene 4.
Clown (sings). I am slain by a fair and cruel maid.
description: A large, high window looks out into the sea showing jagged rocky cliffs in the distance. A cherub is sitting on the window ledge while in the foreground someone is lying face down on a bed.

caption: She saw instead of her own face in the glass, the face of her dead Aunt Harriet.
description: A woman looks into a mirror hanging above a chest of drawers and sees the reflection of a dead relative instead of her own face.

caption: Cataract and artificial pupil.
description:
Depiction of the steps involved in the operation for cataract and artificial pupil.
The caption reads in the original French: Cataracte et pupille artificielle.

caption: The story of the princess.
description: A young woman is leaning on the windowsill of her bedroom looking into the distance and barely listening to the older woman talking to her.

caption: All but Luella shone white in the moonlight.
description: A group of ghosts stands outside a house, surrounding and challenging a living girl.

caption:
Act 1, scene 3.
Maria. My name is Mary, sir.
description: A guest and a maid look slightly awkward as they meet in a hall.

caption: Instinct stronger than training.
description: An artist who was working on his painting does his best to hold back a dog trying to jump at his sly-looking male model.

caption: Dreghen's device for steering aerostats.
description:
A man is flying over a plain suspended beneath a balloon attached to his back. He holds as much as he stands on a device bearing two umbrella-shaped wings supposed to help him steer his machine.
Jacob Dreghen, who was a Viennese watchmaker, tested his device on the Champ-de-Mars in Paris in 1812. To make up for the disappointment of seeing his attempt fail miserably, the crowd which had gathered for the occasion punched him and tore apart his machine.
The caption reads in the original French: Appareil de Dreghen pour la direction des aérostats.

caption: Making off.
description: A man walks against the wind at night on a road lined with leafless trees.

caption: Death of madame Blanchard.
description:
A woman is falling from the gondola of a hot-hair balloon flying over the roofs.
Sophie Blanchard was the widow of aeronaut Pierre Blanchard, and an aeronaut herself. On July 6, 1819, as she was taking part in an exhibition, the fireworks she was supposed to launch set fire to her balloon, causing it to crash on the roofs.
The caption reads in the original French: Mort de madame Blanchard.

caption: Disarticulation of the four fingers and of the metacarpal bones.
description:
Depiction of the steps involved in the amputation of the four fingers and in that of the thumb.
The caption reads in the original French: Désarticulation des quatre derniers doigts et des métacarpes.

caption: A black-draped long arm was seen to rise and make a motion.
description: A group of ghostly figures wearing black robes and veils faces the right side of the picture and performs some mysterious ritual, as more ordinary and plain-looking people stand in the background, looking puzzled.

caption: Die nächtliche Heerschau.
description:
A dead Napoleonic soldier beats the drum at night on a battlefield making the other dead soldiers rise from their graves.
Die nächtliche Heerschau is a poem by Joseph Christian von Zedlitz.

caption: How eloquent!
description:
A parrot behind a desk gives a lecture to a winged female audience.
The caption reads in the original French: Quelle éloquence !

caption: Giant statues.
description:
Night view of Easter Island and statues representing gigantic human faces near the edge of a cliff. Drawn from a sketch.
The caption reads in the original French: Statues géantes.

caption: Closure of wounds.
description:
Examples of different types of sutures and the instruments required to carry them out.
The caption reads in the original French: Réunions.

caption: Saint Basil's Church on the Red Square, Mosow.
description:
View of Saint Basil’s Cathedral, also known as the Cathedral of Vasili the Blessed, on the Red Square in Moscow. Drawn from a photograph.
The caption reads in the original French: Église Saint-Vasili sur la Place Rouge à Moscou.

caption: Lenore.
description:
A man with a skull-like face rides on horseback with a young woman behind him. She clings to him as they travel through eerie landscapes with skeletons and torture scenes. The horse blows flames through its nostrils while crossing a bridge.
Lenore is a poem by Gottfried August Bürger.

caption: Methods of holding the bistoury.
description:
A hand is depicted holding a bistoury in six different ways.
The caption reads in the original French: Manières de tenir le bistouri.

caption: Ritter Olaf.
description:
A man holding a goblet at the wedding table celebrates life, his new wife at his side, as the executioner with his ax waits for him in the background.
Ritter Olaf is a poem by Heinrich Heine.

caption: A most impertinent bird.
description:
A bearded man and the goat he is riding have stopped before a large bird wearing a hat and standing on a rock.
The first verse of the rhyme goes:
An inquisitive little sparrow
Ask’d every man in Wales
Why parrots had long noses
And foxes had long tails.

caption: Society Islands—Bora Bora.
description:
View of a pointed rock overlooking the sea at Bora Bora, an island in the archipelago of the Society Islands in the South Pacific Ocean.
The caption reads in the original French: Îles madréporiques : Bora-Bora.

caption: Poor dear Grand-Papa.
description:
An older man is tripping over a gigantic “T.”
The “Poor Dear Grand-Papa” rhyme goes:
What is the matter with Grand-Papa?
“What can the matter be?”
“He’s broken his leg in trying to spell
“Tommy without a T.”

caption: Little Jack Tar.
description:
A dog wearing a hat and smoking a pipe stands on a dock in the rain with an umbrella stemming from his nose and a sail tied to his tail.
The “Little Jack Tar” rhyme goes:
There was a little dog, such a nice little dog,
And he was such a funny little fellow;
He used his tail for a leg-of-mutton sail,
And his nose for an um-br-ella.

caption: Aftåget.
description: A man stands on a grassy height overlooking a stretch of water and contemplates the flashing chariot of the rising sun.

caption: You're telling me, in a grieved tone, that you are rich.
description:
A cat-headed female figure stands wearing luxury clothes belonging to the upper class.
The caption reads in the original French: Tu me dis, d’un ton lamentable, que tu es riche.

caption: A very harsh man named Mr. Vulture.
description:
A vulture-headed figure wearing a heavy coat and a top hat stands in a room with a trunk on the floor.
The caption reads in the original French: Un homme très dur, qui s’appelait Mr. Vautour.

caption: We'll incise the muscles, saw the bones, in a word, cure the patient.
description:
In a hospital room, a shark dressed as a surgeon explains to a small group of animals how he is going to treat and cure the worried patient lying in bed.
The caption reads in the original French: Nous allons inciser les muscles, scier les os, enfin guérir le malade…

caption: Endowed with a fearsome figure, the misocampe enjoys an unparalleled ferocity.
description:
A fantasy insect with large round eyes stands on two legs and carries a long and thin sword at the side.
The caption reads in the original French: Doué d’une figure terrible, le misocampe jouit d’une férocité sans exemple.

caption: A Paris lion.
description:
A sharply dressed and styled lion-headed figure carries a stick under his arm and smokes a cigar.
Around the year 1840, lion and lionne were the names given to fashionable young people, free in their behavior, not averse to some degree of eccentricity, and spending money liberally.
The caption reads in the original French: Un lion de Paris.

caption: I am the great poet, Katogan.
description:
A cockatoo with anthropomorphous features stretches out his arms like wings, dropping sheets of paper and poppy heads in the process.
The caption reads in the original French: Je suis le grand poète Katogan.

caption: The duchess, who came into this world to be a stout and healthy person...
description:
An owl-headed female figure stands in an evening dress.
The caption reads in the original French: Madame la duchesse, qui était venue au monde pour être une bonne grosse personne, bien portante…

caption: Aftåget.
description: A group of armed men is taking tumultuous action to free one of them who is tied to a tree.

caption:
Dipladenia atropurpurea.
After the "Garden."
description: Mandevilla atroviolacea is a vine in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the southern regions of the Americas and provides colorful, decorative flowers.

caption: I took a liking to quite fashionable public gardens.
description:
A group of animals with human-like features is enjoying an outing in the park where children, represented as insects or young birds, jump a rope, or bowl a hoop.
The caption reads in the original French: J’avais pris en affection un jardin public fort à la mode.

caption: Dear Kitty!
description:
On a roof lined with short chimneys, a tomcat in a jacket and top hat is wooing a lady cat wearing a dress.
The caption reads in the original French: Chère Minette !

caption: To the sex that embellishes life!
description:
A hippopotamus with anthropomorphous features raises his flute of champagne to the fair sex.
The caption reads in the original French: Au sexe qui embellit la vie !!!

caption: Esquimaux village.
description: View of an ice field surrounded by cliffs, with igloos and people on sleighs or playing with dogs.

caption: Saint Anthony.
description: Saint Anthony is depicted as an older cleric sitting at a table with a large book open before him as horrific and taunting visions surround him.

caption: My mother, who has always been a bit of a quaintrelle...
description:
A female greyhound with human-like posture and dress is seen in profile holding her shawl tight.
The caption reads in the original French: Ma mère, qui a toujours été assez petite-maîtresse…

caption: The Battle of the Nile.
description: A wrecked ship is ablaze on the sea, as a boat from another ship comes to the rescue of survivors who took refuge on a floating mast.

caption: The Battle of the Nile.
description: At a performance of a historical reconstruction of the Battle of the Nile, a man in the audience stands up and starts throwing fruit at the stage.

caption:
A lay of St. Nicholas.
The Golden Legend.
description: In the refectory or kitchen of a monastery, a monk kicks an angry Devil into the fire of an open and smoking oven.

caption: "The Valvos! the Valvos!" they screamed.
description:
A monstrous figure with big round eyes, a mouth wide open like that of a fish, and a tail resembling an octopus’s tentacle comes forward, scaring a swarm of smaller creatures.
The caption reads in the original French: ‘Le Volvoce ! le Volvoce !’ cria-t-on.

caption: We're not here to bark, but to bite.
description:
A hyena-headed creature stands to speak up from the benches at the parliament.
The caption reads in the original French: Il ne s’agit pas d’aboyer ici, mais de mordre.

caption: ... From dictation by the Magpie, a friend of his.
description:
A bird-headed female figure stands with a quill in her hand, striking the pose of a writer busy with her work.
This illustration was used as a headpiece for the story titled “Histoire d’un lièvre : sa vie privée publique et politique écrite sous sa dictée par une pie, son amie,” rendered in English as “History of a Hare. Written from Dictation by the Magpie.” The English edition (London: 1877) lacks this illustration.
The caption reads in the original French: … Sous sa dictée par une pie, son amie.

caption: Mr. Bumble and Mrs. Corney taking tea.
description: A man and a woman are sitting at a table and having tea by the fireplace. Kittens are playing on the carpet before the hearth, as the man seems to be romancing the woman.

caption: A dive for life.
description: A boat draws alongside a harpooned whale, which dives underwater whipping its tail.

caption: The wedding-day.
description: A skeleton dressed and armed as a seventeenth century pirate sits on a barrel in a cellar. Near him, a child lies on the ground, as three or four people can be seen looking in through a hole in the wall.

caption: Church on the Rhine.
description: A narrow path overlooking the Rhine leads to the apse of a church located at the top of a hill.

caption: The passage of the torrent.
description:
A young man carries a young woman in his arms to help her across a stream in the forest of the island of Mauritius.
The caption reads in the original French: Passage du torrent.
When available, the captions in English were taken from the edition of Paul and Virginia published by W. S. Orr And Co., London, 1839.

caption: 1. Rosa englenteria. — 2. Rosa muscata alba. — 3. Libanotis. — 4. Cistus ledon myrtifolium. — 5. Herba benedicta.
description: Floral ornaments inspired by the shapes of Rosa englenteria (possibly Rosa eglanteria, aka Rosa rubiginosa. The appearance of the flower seems consistent with the design), Rosa moschata alba, Libanotis, Cistus monspeliensis subsp. ledon (a species of rockrose), and Cnicus benedictus (St. Benedict’s thistle).

caption: The smuggler's leap.
description: Two men riding horses keep struggling even as they’re falling down a cliff.

caption: 1. Ilex coccifera. — 2. Fumaria latifolia minor. — 3. Quinquefolium theophrasti. — 4. Hypericum alexandrinum. — 5. Jasminium cœruleum.
description: Floral ornaments inspired by the shapes of leaves and flowers from Quercus coccifera, Fumaria capreolata (?), Potentilla recta (?), Hypericum crispum, and Oplonia spinosa.

caption: The cynotaph.
description: The ghost of a bespectacled woman chases the ghost of a dog by moonlight through the tombs of a cemetery.

caption: A café.
description:
A seal, a walrus and a polar bear (?) are seated at the terrace of a Paris café, eating ice-cream.
The caption reads in the original French: Un café.

caption: 1. Chamæitea. — 2. Iva muschata. — 3. Brassica Anglica. — 4. Lychnis plumaria. — 5. Lychnis sylvestris.
description: Floral ornaments inspired by the shapes of a plant described by John Parkinson as “the straight dwarfe Willow with narrow leaves”, Ajuga iva, Brassica maritima, Lychnis flos-cuculi, and Silene dioica.

caption: How do you like butterfly hunting?
description:
A bird with anthropomorphous features is about to catch a butterfly with a butterfly net.
The caption reads in the original French: Que dites-vous de la chasse aux papillons ?

caption: Nuremberg.
description: View of the Pegnitz River and the old town of Nuremberg.

caption: The peer brought along the most handsome tomcat of the peerage.
description:
A lady cat greets a posh and elegant male guest in her reception room.
The caption reads in the original French: Le pair amena le plus beau matou de la pairie.

caption: The shepherd comes to the Arch of Snakes.
description: A young shepherd holding his crook stands before a gate made of countless entwined snakes.

caption: The hand of glory.
description: A man is sitting at a table and counting his money by candlelight. He gapes in terror as the door opens and reflects the shadow of a figure holding a knife.

caption: Eisenkopf.
description: A young woman with three napkins in her hand runs away from a horned figure with glowing eyes, which can be seen through an opening in a wall of fire.

caption: The Ingoldsby penance.
description: A screaming man runs away in terror from a pursuer chasing him with a flogger in one hand and his head in the other.

caption: How the prince arrived at the city of immortality.
description: A knight in armor climbs up a ladder with his sword drawn to fight the four-headed monster waiting for him at the top.

caption: The tragedy.
description: The legs of a man are sticking out of a barrel placed under a drainpipe ending in a gargoyle’s head.

caption: Excalibur.
description: Arthur, in a rowboat, receives the sword Excalibur from the Lady of the Lake, who remains hidden below the surface of the water. Illustration for the poem “Morte d’Arthur” by Alfred, Lord Tennyson.

caption:
Britomart chaceth Ollyphant;
Findes Scudamour distrest:
Assayes the house of Busyrane,
Where loves spoyles are exprest.
description: A woman equipped and armed as a knight has drawn her sword and leans over a fire, covering her head with her shield.

caption:
Paridell rapeth Hellenore:
Malbecco her pursewes:
Findes emongst satyres, whence with him
To turne she doth refuse.
description: A young man, seen from behind, is sitting next to a woman with a bunch of flowers in her lap. He plays the lute to her under the gaze of an old man holding a purse and a key.

caption:
The iolly satyrs, full of fresh delight,
Came dauncing forth, and with them nimbly  ledd
Faire Hellenore, with girlonds all bespredd,
Whom their May-lady they had newly made.
description: A woman walks between two satyrs, her arms around their necks, as more cheerful satyrs follow close behind.

caption: Lizina comes out of the jar.
description: A woman comes out of a jar stored in a cellar where a large cat is waiting for her.

caption:
The witch creates a snowy lady,
Like to Florimell,
Who wrong'd by Carle by Proteus sav'd,
Is sought by Paridell.
description: A bearded sea-creature stands in a scallop-shaped sea chariot pulled by two walruses and holds tightly a half-naked woman.

caption: With human corpses he made a stew.
description:
A man in a chef’s outfit watches over a pot on the stove from which human body parts can be seen sticking out.
The caption reads in the original French: De cadavres humains se fit un pot-au-feu.

caption:
The enimies of Temperaunce
besiege her dwelling place:
Prince Arthur them repelles, and fowle
Maleger doth deface.
description: An archer riding a tiger aims an arrow at a knight armed with a lance.

caption:
A teme of dolphins raunged in aray,
Drew the smooth charett of sad Cymoent;
They were all taught by Triton, to obey
To the long raynes, at her commandement:
description: A woman holds the reins of a sea chariot shaped as a sea-shell as another woman sits at the back looking thoughtful.

caption:
He spide far off a mighty giauntesse,
Fast flying on a courser dapled gray,
From a bold knight, that with great hardinesse.
Her hard pursewd, and sought for to suppresse.
description: A woman carrying a mace rides away with a prisoner thrown across the neck of her horse as a knight comes charging with a lance.

caption:
Bold Marinell of Britomart,
Is throwne on the rich strond:
Faire Florimell of Arthur is
Long followed, but not fond.
description: A woman equipped as a knight and riding a white horse has just thrown her opponent to the ground.

caption: Magnetic healer.
description:
A man and a woman are sitting opposite each other in front of an audience. The man leans towards the woman with his arms stretched out as she seems to be asleep.
The caption reads in the original French: Le magnétiseur animal.

caption: A founder's workshop during the Bronze Epoch.
description: A prehistoric man pours molten metal into a mold buried in the ground while another checks a sword whose mold lies at his feet.

caption:
Vaine Braggadocchio getting Guyons
horse is made the scorne
Of knighthood trew, & is of fayre
Belphoebe fowle forlorne.
description: A woman dressed as a huntress and carrying a spear and a horn is spied on by a man hiding behind a tree.

caption:
Guyon findes Mamon in a delve,
Sunning his threasure hore:
Is by him tempted, and led down,
To see his secrete store.
description: A knight in armor has gone down stairs made of high stones to meet an old man curled up over a pile of coins he keeps in his lap. As the coins keep falling off and the old man can’t seem to be able to get a grip on his treasure, a dead tree looking like a skeleton bends threateningly over him.

caption:
Guyon, by Palmers governaunce,
passing through perils great,
Doth overthrow the bowre of blisse,
and Acrasie defeat.
description: Sirens or mermaids are sitting and lying on rocks by the seafront, and waving at a ship passing in the distance.

caption:
Pyrochles does with Guyon fight,
And Furors chayne unbinds,
Of whom sore hurt, for his revenge
Atin Cymochles finds.
description: A man lies leisurely on a ground covered with leaves and flowers and is surrounded by half-naked women. In the bottom left corner, another man armed with a spear seems to burst into the picture.

caption: Funeral ceremonies during the Iron Epoch.
description: Grieving people are gathered around a funeral pyre as the man who presides over the ceremony gestures toward the fire.

caption: The earliest regular conflicts between men of the Stone Age; or the entrenched camp of Furfooz.
description: A group of prehistoric men conducts an assault against a camp protected by a wall from which the defenders are shooting arrows.

caption:
The horn, at the gate of the Barbican tower,
Was blown with a loud twenty-trumpeter power.
description: A frail-looking fantasy creature, showing a mix of human and animal features, blows a horn and holds a banner.

caption:
Lurline was affected, and owned, with a tear
That a story so mournful had ne'er met her ear…
description: Female sea creatures are gathered around a male figure carrying a sword, smoking a pipe, and looking puzzled.

caption: Man of the Polished-Stone Epoch.
description: A disheveled man with a club in one hand is half-kneeling on a rock and stretching his arm out, as though pointing to something unexpected high in the distance. He carries a stone axe at the waist and a second one is lying at his feet along with an animal jawbone and a stone polisher.

caption: There's an old woman dwells upon Tappington Moor.
description: An old woman wearing a witch’s hat walks outside a run-down house with a thatched roof as a black cat rubs her legs.

caption:
With a countenance Kelly alone could put on
Made one grasshopper spring to the door—and was gone!
description: A man runs as fast as his legs can carry him to escape a ghost coming out of a dark opening.

caption: The earliest navigators.
description: A prehistoric man wearing animal skin makes a boat from a piece of tree trunk cut in half.

caption: They'd such very odd heads and such very odd tails.
description: A gathering of underwater monsters is standing by as though waiting for the cue that would set them loose.

caption:
Now climb who dare where he swings in air
And pluck me five locks of the dead man’s hair!
description: A man hanged on the gallows is silhouetted against a cloudy, smoky sky as three people stand on the stretch of grass beneath him.

caption: Hey! up the chimney, lass! hey, after you!
description: Witches are flying away riding brooms and following black cats in the sky. One of them turns around to wave at us.

caption:
A grand pas de deux
Performed in the very grand style by these two.
description: A devil-like figure wearing a fancy costume and a fiendish smile dances gracefully with a lady in a red dress.

caption: The little man had seated himself in the center of the circle upon the large skull.
description: A man with a hat and a mischievous smile is awkwardly sitting on a skull, a large grimoire open before him, seemingly not minding the vaguely threatening company of strange animals.

caption: A flood of brown-stout he was up to his knees in.
description: A monk finds himself in an underground room flooded with brown stout, and he pulls up the bottom of his robe to prevent it from getting soaked.

caption:
The monks and the nuns in the dead of the night
Tumble, all of them, out of their beds in affright.
description: A short monk holds a lantern in the viewer’s direction, looking puzzled, as other monks and nuns gather around him, looking towards us with an expression of surprise on their faces.

caption: A skeleton, portions of which have been burnt, from the tombs of Hallstatt.
description: Remains of a skeleton dating back to the Iron Age. It was found in a tomb in Hallstatt, a village in Austria which gave its name to the Hallstatt culture.

caption: As I lay a-thynkynge, he rode upon his way.
description: A knight riding a horse is seen from above and half hidden by a large branch as if the viewer was hiding in a tree.

caption:
—Bone bodkin, from the lacustrine habitations of Switzerland.
—Bone bodkin, from the lacustrine habitations of Switzerland.
—Carpenter's chisel, from the lacustrine habitations of Switzerland.
—Bone needle.
description: Assortment of prehistoric tools made of bone, such as bodkin, needle, etc, found in the remains of lake dwellings in Switzerland.

caption:
—Serpentine hatchet-hammers, from the lacustrine habitations of Switzerland.
—Another hatchet-hammer, from the lacustrine habitations of Switzerland.
description: Two hammer axes found in the neolithic lakeside settlements of Switzerland.

caption:
—Mode of fixing the handle to a Scandinavian hatchet.
—Another mode of fixing the handle to a Scandinavian hatchet.
description: Two models of Scandinavian hatchets show different ways of fixing the head to the handle.

caption: Gardening tool made of stag's horn (after Boucher de Perthes).
description: Prehistoric gardening tool taking advantage of the natural spiky shape of stags’ antlers.

caption: What, indeed, could she do?
description: A young woman wearing a feathered hat lies flat at the very top of a mountain peak, watching soldiers making their way to her hiding place.

caption: Man of the Reindeer Epoch.
description: A man stands in a wooded area holding an ax in one hand and an animal’s jawbone in the other. He looks to the side as a woman sits beside him.

caption: Man in the Great Bear and Mammoth Epoch.
description: Three men wearing animal skins and armed with clubs and stone axes are fighting a large bear as more men come out of a cave to help them.

caption: Position of skeletons in a Swedish tomb of the Stone Age.
description: Section view of a prehistoric tomb showing three skeletons in the position they were buried.

caption: Mill for crushing oilseed.
description:
View of an oilseed mill with two millstones and a worker attending to it.
The caption reads in the original French: Moulin pour écraser les graines oléagineuses.

caption:
Peter, the lay-brother, sallow and spare,
Peep'd through the key-hole, and—what saw he there?
description: A monk has stopped in a stairway to peep through a keyhole.

caption: If Orpheus first produced the waltz.
description: A young man plays the flute in the foreground, while three couples are dancing to the music in a landscape with mountains overlooking a stretch of water. One of the couples consists of a young woman and a satyr, another of a young woman and a tree, and the third of two dogs.

caption: Then old Mrs. Rabbit […] went through the wood to the baker’s.
description: Mrs. Rabbit wears an orange cape and is looking angry. She strides to the baker’s carrying a basket and her umbrella.

caption: Sea-biscuit cutting and rolling machine.
description:
Machine with cogs and cylinders used to cut out and roll sea-biscuits.
The caption reads in the original French: Machine pour découper et rouler les biscuits de mer.

caption: Édouard Adam's distillation device.
description:
Jean-Édouard Adam’s distillation device patented in 1805.
The caption reads in the original French: Appareil distillatoire d’Édouard Adam, breveté en 1805.

caption: Jumped into a can.
description: Peter Rabbit is up to his neck in a watering can splashing water around in his effort to get out.

caption: Workshop for filling and soldering food cans.
description:
View of a workshop where food is canned, coming from the kitchen on trays, then being put into cans, and the cans soldered before finally being taken away.
The caption reads in the original French: Atelier de remplissage et de soudure des boîtes.

caption: Désiré Savalle's device for rectifying alcohol.
description:
Cross section of a distillery showing Désiré Savalle’s device for rectifying alcohol showing the machine in working situation.
The caption reads in the original French: Appareil de rectification des alcools de M. Désiré Savalle.

caption: Public and private hospitals.
description:
Two men are lying in bed at night. The first one gives the other a reproving look as the second man is dying.
The caption reads in the original French: Les hôpitaux et les cliniques.

caption: Peter never stopped running.
description: Scared Peter Rabbit runs flat out on a country road.

caption: Jumped out of a window, upsetting three plants.
description: Peter Rabbit is suspended in mid-air scared and shocked by his own clumsiness as he has just knocked over three flower pots.

caption: Wheat grinder windmill.
description:
Cutaway view of a windmill designed to grind wheat.
The caption reads in the original French: Le moulin à vent appliqué à la mouture du blé.

caption: Amine at the feet of Boabdil.
description:
In a Moorish architectural setting, a man lies on a couch in the company of a woman sitting on the floor, a sitar by her side. Behind them are two female dancers and a man standing with his arms crossed. In the background, the moon shines over a mountainous horizon.
Steel engraving.

caption:
Pied woodpecker. Picus major, Linn.
Showing progress of change in coloration of head, in both sexes.
description: The great spotted woodpecker (Dendrocopos major) is a bird in the family Picidae. It is a widespread woodpecker, common in parks and woodland, and also often seen in gardens. It feeds on insects, small rodents and young birds, and even on seed and fruit.

caption:
Green woodpecker.
Gecinus viridis, Linn.
description: The European green woodpecker (Picus viridis) is a bird in the family Picidae with a distinctive green plumage, brightened by a red cap. It lives at the edges of woodlands, parks or even gardens and feeds on insects, with a strong predilection for ants.

caption: Riddle grape stemming for the production of superior quality Burgundy wine.
description:
Three men are standing around a riddle, stemming grapes which will be used to make superior Burgundy wine.
The caption reads in the original French: L’égrappage du raisin au châssis, pour la fabrication des vins supérieurs en Bourgogne.

caption: Pomace press used in the Médoc and Cognac areas.
description:
A man turns a wheel that operates a marc press. Marc, or pomace, is what remains of grapes when the fruit has been pressed for wine. It is used to make pomace brandy.
The caption reads in the original French: Pressoir à marc de raisin en usage dans le Médoc et à Cognac.

caption: Isaac Bérard experimenting his distillation machine alone at night.
description:
A young man shovels coal at night next to a distillation machine.
Isaac Bérard (1770-1819) was a wine distiller who invented a new and economical distillation process, and created a machine that rivaled the ones commonly used at the time.
The caption reads in the original French: Isaac Bérard fait seul, la nuit, l’expérience de son cylindre analyseur à diaphragme métallique.

caption: The favourite slave.
description:
A man wearing a turban stands before a seated woman seen in profile in a luxurious Moorish setting.
Steel engraving.

caption: The miracle.
description:
A man performs a spectacular ritual, which results in rising flames and smoke, in front of bewildered onlookers.
Steel engraving.

caption: Olive oil press in southern France.
description:
Inside a press-house in southern France, four men strive to move the pole that operates an olive oil press.
The caption reads in the original French: La presse à huile d’olive dans le midi de la France.

caption: The magic dial.
description:
A man wearing a cuirass and holding a gonfalon points his scimitar towards a circle on the wall behind him. The man before him has a knee on the floor and looks at the light burning at the center of the circle. In the background is a skeleton dressed in a robe and a hat and holding a globe.
Steel engraving.

caption: General view of a distillery equipped with Désiré Savalle's devices and producing alcoholic liquids and fermented juices before and after rectification.
description:
Cross section of a distillery equipped with devices designed by Désiré Savalle and his company for the distillation and rectification of alcoholic liquids and fermented juices.
The caption reads in the original French: Vue d’ensemble d’une distillerie montée avec les appareils Désiré Savalle et produisant la distillation des liquides alcooliques ou des jus fermentés et leur rectification.

caption: Charlatans.
description:
Three skeleton-like figures with torsos made of bottles and other medicine containers rejoice and dance on a pile of money as funerals take place in the background.
The caption reads in the original French: Les charlatans.

caption: Memories of cholera morbus.
description:
A man is lying in the street, his hat beside him, as a horrified woman rushes into a building with a cloth pressed against her nose, and a hearse passes in the background.
The caption reads in the original French: Souvenirs du choléra morbus.

caption: His face is bright and his leg drunken.
description:
Three doctors in their robes have gathered to enjoy a merry dinner.
The caption reads in the original French: Sa face est rayonnante et sa jambe avinée.

caption: A mule broke out with chicken-pox—broke out his tent, you see.
description: A mule in uniform and with red spots all over his face rushes out of his tent, making the other mules jump with surprise.

caption: One day, within a grove of spruce, they gathered gum to chew.
description: Mules in uniform are scattered in a forest and are busy gathering gum.

caption: He rested in a borax ring, to keep the bugs away.
description: A mule is sleeping inside a white ring of borax powder, as a multitude of various insects stands outside of it, unable to get in.

caption: Homeopathy.
description:
A doctor, brandishing a hammer and aided by an assistant, is about to hit a screaming man who has a large bump on his forehead.
The caption reads in the original French: L’homéopathie.

caption: And how they chased those twenty mules and punctured well their hide!
description: Mules in uniform are running all over the place to escape a swarm of bees disturbed by the smoke of their fire.

caption: Mathieu Orfila.
description: Full-length representation of a man in a robe and a long hat singing and playing the guitar. Mathieu Orfila was a French toxicologist and chemist, and a pioneer in the field of forensic toxicology.

caption: License and trading dues.
description:
A man on a platform holds a jar he is probably trying to sell to the crowd gathered around him. In the foreground, a desk and various attributes of the medical profession can be seen.
The caption reads in the original French: La patente et le droit d’exercice.

caption: My dear friend, I made my fortune with a bad play.
description:
A pyramid-shaped jumble of faces showing the characters of a play and their various expressions.
The caption reads in the original French: J’ai fait ma fortune, mon ami, en faisant une mauvaise pièce.

caption: To Musique.
description:
A woman stands playing the lute in a sparsely furnished room.
This picture is an illustration for the poem “To Music, to Becalm His Fever.”

caption: And three or four with hearty cheer, jumped in like jolly frogs.
description: Three mules are having a bath in the same tub, splashing and laughing, as the other mules get ready for their turn.

caption: Haarlem—Saint Bavo Cathedral and the Meat Market.
description:
The Saint Bavo Cathedral in Haarlem is on the market square along with the Meat Market (Vleeshal), a seventeenth-century building which can be seen beyond the northern front of the cathedral.
The caption reads in the original French: Haarlem. L’église St Bavon et la boucherie.

caption: Amsterdam—the Damrak.
description:
View of the avenue busy with people and carts, with a bridge stretching across the canal and ships in the distance.
Photoengraving from a charcoal drawing.
The caption reads in the original French: Amsterdam. Le Damrak.

caption: My name is Captain Rolando.
description:
A man wearing a hat and a cuirass turns around to look at us and introduce himself.
The caption reads in the original French: Je m’appelle le capitaine Rolando.

caption: Zutphen—the market.
description:
View of the Zutphen market place with the Wijnhuistoren (Winehouse Tower) built in 1627.
Photoengraving from a charcoal drawing.
The caption reads in the original French: Zutphen. Le marché.

caption: Her hair was simply tied at the back with a bunch of flowers, in the Lacedaemonian fashion.
description:
Portrait of a young woman with a round face, a plain dress, and flowers in her hair.
The caption reads in the original French: Ses cheveux étoient simplement noués par derrière avec un bouquet de fleurs, à la façon des lacédémoniennes.

caption: Amsterdam—the Waag.
description:
Formerly known as Saint Antony’s Gate (Sint Antoniespoort), the weighing house is the oldest non-religious building in Amsterdam. It ceased being used as a weighing house in the early 19th century, but the name remained.
Photoengraving from an etching.
The caption reads in the original French: Amsterdam. La porte Saint-Antoine.

caption: Leeuwarden—Oldehove.
description:
The Oldehove is a leaning tower in the city of Leeuwarden, the Netherlands. Its construction began in 1529 as part of an abandoned project to replace the old Saint Vitus Church.
Photoengraving from a charcoal drawing.
The caption reads in the original French: Leeuwarden. La tour de Saint-Vitus.

caption: Cynthia's last lover.
description: A man and a woman are walking side by side in a garden.

caption: My! How this pony's anger burned! Although it didn't smoke!
description: A hobby horse falls prey to a mob of grey, grimacing imps, but is rescued by the Mule Brigade.

caption: Groningen—the city hall.
description:
View of the Groningen city hall with the Martini Tower on the market square.
The caption reads in the original French: Groningue. L’hôtel de ville.

caption: They each put a gun to my throat and ordered me to tell them who I was.
description:
A young man walking through a forest is stopped by two other men and has a gun pointed to his throat.
The caption reads in the original French: Me mettant chacun le pistolet sous la gorge, ils me sommèrent de leur apprendre qui j’étois.

caption: Rossia macrosoma, d'Orb.
description: The stout bobtail squid (Rossia macrosoma) is a mollusc in the family Sepiolidae. It lives on sandy or muddy bottoms.

caption: The last turning.
description: A man walking away from a house turns around one last time under the rain to wave his handkerchief.

caption: Oh! Molly, Molly, come and judge between us!
description: A man and a woman are holding hands outdoors as a second woman is showing up.

caption: I trust this will never occur again, Cynthia.
description: A man sitting in a wicker chair with a newspaper admonishes his stepdaughter.

caption:
1 — 12. Loligo vulgaris, Lam.
13 — 14. Loligo gahi, d'Orb.
description: The European squid (Loligo vulgaris), or common squid, is a mollusc in the family Loliginidae. it can be found from the Faroe Islands to the west coast of Africa, and it will migrate vertically and horizontally according to changes in its environment. It feeds on fishes and crustaceans.

caption: Shakespeare and the musical glasses.
description: In a sitting-room, young gentlemen and ladies are conversing two by two by the fireplace.

caption: Smooth trunkfish (Rhinesomus triqueter).
description:
Aquatint depicting the smooth trunkfish (Rhinesomus triqueter), a fish in the family Ostraciidae. It is commonly found on coral reefs where its bony carapace and its ability to release toxins when excited protect it from predators. It feeds on small invertebrates such as mollusks, worms, crustaceans, etc.
The caption reads in the original French: Le coffre triangulaire. (Ostracion triqueter, Linn.)

caption:
York cathedral church.
Capitals and pendants in the chapter house.
description: Architectural decoration from the chapter house of York Minster showing foliated sculptures, human figures, and animals.

caption: Eledone moschatus, Leach.
description: The musky octopus (Eledone moschata) can be found along all the Mediterranean coasts. It has one raw of suckers on each arm and feeds on molluscs, fish, and crustaceans.

caption: Oh! it is no wonder!
description: A young woman lays her head on her stepsister’s shoulder.

caption:
Canterbury Cathedral church.
View of the western towers.
description: The early Canterbury Cathedral was destroyed by fire in 1067 and rebuilt a first time between the eleventh and twelfth centuries, and then a second time from the fourteenth to the sixteenth centuries, when the present nave and the Bell Harry tower were erected. The Norman northwest tower, which can be seen on this picture was demolished in 1834.

caption:
1— 7. Onychoteuthis blanksii, d'Orb.
8 — 12. Onychoteuthis dussumieri, d'Orb.
13. Onychoteuthis platytera, d'Orb.
description: The clubhook squid (Onychoteuthis banksii) is a mollusc in the family Onychoteuthidae. it lives in the central and north Atlantic areas, where at night it can be found at the surface.

caption:
Starling.
Sturnus vulgaris, Linn.
Winter.
description: The common starling (Sturnus vulgaris) is a passerine bird in the family Sturnidae. Although native to Europe, it is now found worldwide, except in neotropical regions. Starlings are omnivorous and gather in large flocks that can be made of thousands of individuals.

caption: The merry-go-round.
description: People in evening dresses walk wearily around a circle lined with gold coins as more gold keeps raining from a cloud floating over the center of the circle.

caption: Histioteuthis bonelliana, d'Orb.
description: The umbrella squid (Histioteuthis bonnellii), also known as Bonnelli’s jewel squid is a mollusc in the family Histioteuthidae. it can be found in the Atlantic Ocean and between the coasts of Australia and New Zealand. Unlike octopuses, squids have ten arms, or tentacles.

caption: Plenty of good fish in the sea.
description: Women in 1900s bathing suits are enjoying the water as a rising wave is coming along.

caption: Gibson Girl's profile.
description: Profile portrait of a Gibson Girl.

caption: When a man's in love.
description: A man is kneeling on a beach overlooked by a rock shaped as a woman’s face while above him floats a cloud also shaped as a woman’s face.

caption:
Parasites.
Basking in the golden sunshine.
description: A small group of sycophants is fawning to an imposing lady wearing a luxurious dress and a surly face.

caption:
Great grey shrike.
Lanius excubitor, Linn.
description: The great grey shrike (Lanius excubitor) is a passerine bird in the family Laniidae. It can be found in the colder regions of the northern hemisphere, although it usually migrates to winter in temperate areas. It feeds on small mammals, birds, and insects. The great grey shrike has the remarkable habit of storing uneaten prey on thorns or spikes found on its territory.

caption:
1. Philonexis quoyanus, d'Orb.
2-6. Philonexis tuberculatus, d'Orb.
7. Philonexis velifer, d'Orb.
description: The blanket octopus (Tremoctopus violaceus) is a rarely observed species that lives in the open sea. Females are much larger and heavier than males.

caption: Pinnoctopus cordiformis, d'Orb.
description: Pinnoctopus cordiformis is a cephalopod in the Octopodidae family. It lives in rock cavities with narrow openings and is sometimes called reef octopus (New Zealand).

caption:
Blue titmouse.
Parus cæruleus, Linn.
description: The Eurasian blue tit (Cyanistes caeruleus) is a passerine bird in the family Paridae very common and widespread in Europe. It lives in woodland, but is also often found in gardens and parks. It feeds mostly on insects but will also eat seeds.

caption: Gibson Girl frontal portrait.
description: Frontal portrait of a Gibson Girl seen slightly from below.

caption:
Scops owl.
Scops giu, Scops.
description: The Eurasian scops owl (Otus scops) is a small nocturnal bird, approximately the size of an Eurasian blackbird or a thrush. It has a large head with distinctive ear tufts and its patterned plumage mimics very effectively the bark of the trees on which it perches. It feeds mainly on insects.

caption: What is most beautiful on earth.
description:
Three young women in evening dresses seem to be waiting for a dance—and a dancing partner.
The caption reads in the original French: Ce qu’il y a de plus beau sur la terre…

caption:
Little owl.
Athene noctua, Scop.
description: Little owls (Athene noctua) are small birds active during the daytime. They can often be seen in open country, perched on poles or branches. They feed on insects, small mammals, reptiles, and other small birds.

caption: Midst of all was a cold white face.
description: A man wearing a hat stands somewhat bent on a windy road lined with trees and electric poles as a blackbird flies by.

caption: Her brothers were turned into twelve ravens.
description: A young woman picking lilies is surrounded by a flock of ravens.

caption: I am born of a thousand storms, and grey with the rushing rains.
description: A tornado made of human-like figures sweeps over a cliff.

caption: They had a coffin made of transparent glass, and they laid her in it.
description: Somewhere in the mountains, the body of a young woman lies inside a transparent coffin watched over by a crow, an owl and a man sitting on a rock.

caption: The bagpiper re-appeared on the market place.
description: A bagpiper wearing a large hat stands in a cobbled street lined with medieval houses. He plays his music to the rats, already swarming at his feet, to lure them away.

caption:
Spotted eagle.
Aquila nævia, J. F. Gmelin.
Drawn from a living specimen captured near Colchester,
Oct. 29th 1891.
description: The greater spotted eagle (Clanga clanga) is a migratory bird of prey that lives in forests and near wet areas such as swamps and marshes. It breeds from eastern Europe eastward to Russia and as far as China. It feeds mostly on small mammals.

caption: The ship went away as swiftly as any bird in the air.
description: A ship whose figurehead is a swan with outstretched wings is flying over a cliff, where people gather to meet its passenger: a boy seated at the stern.

caption: Hairstyle, hat, cane, and fan.
description:
A series of small illustrations showing figures sporting various styles and garments.
The caption reads in the original French: La coiffure, le chapeau, la canne et l’éventail.

caption: I hid him in the cupboard.
description: A gigantic and hideous troll holding a trident leans towards a frail princess in a threatening way.

caption: Stout Robin hath a narrow escape.
description: Robin Hood is kneeling on the stony bank of a river he is about to cross. An arrow sticking out of the water suggests that someone has been shooting at him.

caption: All alone, those rocks amid—one night I very nearly did!
description: Mermaids are sitting on rocks showing on the surface as a girl stands on the shore in the distance.

caption: My magnificent order at the public house.
description: A boy leans on the counter of a pub behind which the landlord and landlady are listening to him with benevolent smiles.

caption: Honour has come back, as a king, to earth.
description: A figure is seated on a throne suspended in the air, seemingly supported by over-sized faces. Beneath is a slope dotted with crosses and leading to the sea.

caption: The friendly waiter and I.
description: A boy sits at a table full of food and looks at the waiter who is bringing him a pint of beer with quite a sense of flourish.

caption: I am married.
description: A couple is walking down the aisle in a church full of people.

caption: With magic key... Unlocking buds that keep the roses.
description: Ornamental illustration with an oval floral design showing a winged female figure holding a large key.

caption: Ad astra.
description: A frightened boy rides on the back of a soaring eagle, holding on to its neck.

caption: The intruder bowed to the ladies, who rose in some dismay.
description: A man with his hat in one hand enters a room, interrupting three women who were having lunch.

caption: Robin shooteth his last shaft.
description: Robin Hood lies on his bed, holding his bow and getting ready to shoot through the open window, while one of his companions cries beside him.

caption: Mrs. Gummidge casts a damp on our departure.
description: A cart is about to leave to take two children away. Three people have come to bid them farewell, among whom is a woman who can’t help shedding a few tears.

caption: If I had a broomstick.
description: A boy flies on a broom over a city by the sea. He is going down fast.

caption: The mighty fight betwixt Little John and the cook.
description: Two men fight with swords in an inn.

caption: Flopsy, Mopsy, and Cotton-Tail had bread and milk and blackberries for dinner.
description: Three little rabbits are gathered around a large bowl of food.

caption: The old chartist.
description:
A man leans on a stone by a brook and smokes his pipe, smiling as he casts his gaze in the distance, above and beyond a water rat grooming itself on a mud-bank.
This illustration was created for George Meredith’s eponymous poem.

caption: An ill of a mysterious character.
description: A sick dog warmed by a coat lies on a cushion. There is a medicine bottle and a plate with a sponge next to him.

caption: Yet once more on the organ play.
description:
A musician sitting at the organ turns around suddenly, as the man for whom he was playing is dying. Death in person stands behind the instrument.
This illustration was created for Julia Goddard’s poem “From the German of Uhland” and first published in Once a Week on March 23, 1861.

caption: You can greet them and wag a discreet tail twice or thrice with a patronising smile.
description: A bulldog keeps watch at a gate, waiting to greet his owners.

caption: Until her death.
description: A woman is conversing with Death who seems to be wearing a cornet of some sort. On his outstretched arm hangs a monk’s or nun’s robe and in his hand is an hourglass. This picture was first published in Good Words, 1862.

caption: The waiting time.
description: A woman is sitting in front of a loom, her forehead resting in one hand and the rest of her face buried in the shadow. This illustration was first published in the Churchman’s Family Magazine, 1863.

caption: Rosamund, queen of the Lombards.
description:
Rosamund kneels in front of a reading desk, holding a skull with one hand. In the background lies the body of her dead husband.
After the defeat of her people to the Lombards and the subsequent beheading of her father, Rosamund was taken for wife by Alboin, the king of the Lombards. A cruel victor and husband, this latter reportedly once forced her to drink from her father’s skull. The legend has it that she had him murdered by her lover.

caption: Show to the cats who provoke us by hideous grimaces a silent contempt.
description: A bulldog gives a negligent side look at a defensive cat.

caption: The sailor's bride.
description:
A grieving man crouches in the lap of a woman who bends forward to wrap an arm around him and share his sorrow. On the bed behind them lies the body of his bride, revealed by the light coming from the window.
This illustration was created for a poem by Marian E. James and was first published in Once a Week on April 13, 1861.

caption: The little mourner.
description: A child clears the snow from her family grave with a shovel. Illustration for Henry Alford’s poem “The Little Mourner”.

caption: The end of Chevalier de Boys-Bourredon.
description:
In the twilight, three men in a small boat are about to dispose of a bagged body in the river.
The caption reads in the original French: La fin du chevalier de Boys-Bourredon.

caption: Harold Harfagr.
description:
Harold, also known as Harald Harfagr, or Hårfagre (meaning Fairhair in Norwegian) lived approximately between 850 and 932 of our era, and was the first king of Norway. Here he stands next to a tree on which a crow or raven is perched and seems to be whispering to him.
This illustration was created for a poem by George Borrow and first published in Once a Week, 1862.

caption: Danae in the brazen chamber.
description: Locked up by her father, Danae stands in front of a canvas, smoothing her hair with one hand, awaiting the golden rain.

caption: Learn to calculate the height of objects from the top of which you can jump.
description: A young bulldog hesitantly braces himself to jump from a wooden chair.

caption: Jacob hears the voice of the Lord.
description: Jacob has one knee to the ground and tries to look up while protecting his eyes from the divine light.

caption: Death of King Warwulf.
description:
Warwulf, or Warwolf, was a Norse king who, feeling his last moments were approaching, decided to die in a “kingly way.” He thus sailed away one evening on a ship loaded with dry wood, to which he finally set fire.
This illustration was created for the poem “The Death of King Warwolf” by George Walter Thornbury and was first published in the magazine Once a Week on August 30, 1862. Below is the full poem:
 
A Norse legend
The great King Warwolf waxing old,
And feeling that death was nigh at hand,
Resolved to die as a hero should—
Not pent in a bed, and then hid in the sand;
So he clad him brave in his golden mail,
And took his axe and his massiest shield,
And his spear, and his bow, and his two-edged sword—
That no one else but himself could wield.
And he bade them drag his galley forth,
And load it with trunks of the driest pine,
And store it with oak-butts knotty and ringed,
And pile it with fir-cones line on line.
So they set the gold-cloth sails all fair,
And they tied the well-worn helm due north,
And they bore him down on their brazen shields
To the barque that was destined to bear him forth.
Sitting erect on his fir-tree throne,
In his royal robe and glittering crown,
As the fateful galley bore away
Slowly out of sight of the town,
Singing to Odin hymns of praise,
Cheerily, though with a failing breath,
He went in splendour and bold of heart,
In a kingly way to meet King Death.
They watched till they saw the ship go down
Below the long grey line of sea;
And then there arose a great red glare,
That seemed to crimson fitfully
The whole broad heaven, and melt the waves
Into one caldron of blood-red light,
And soon all suddenly there fell
A pitchy gloom, and then came NIGHT.

caption: The lady showed up without fail.
description:
At night, a woman in an ample coat with a hood climbs down a rampart with a knotted rope, awaited by three men in a boat.
The caption reads in the original French: La dame vint sans faute.

caption: The canon.
description:
At the church, the devil is sitting among priests, looking over the book he holds in front of him to hide his face.
This picture is an illustration for “The Devil’s Heir,” from Droll Stories.
The caption reads in the original French: Le chanoine.

caption: Cleopatra.
description:
Cleopatra soaks the pearl of her necklace in a bowl one has to assume filled with vinegar, in the presence of three female musicians and a servant.
Lost, all the lordly pearls that were
Wrung from the sea’s heart, from the green
Coasts of the Indian gulf-river;
Lost, all the loves of the world—so keen
Towards this queen for love of her.
This illustration was created for the eponymous poem by Algernon Swinburne.

caption: Beautiful after the manner of a beautiful, natural monster.
description: A young bulldog looks sideways while sitting on tiles by a wall.

caption: A good pitcherful of water.
description:
In a medieval city, a man leans out of a window of a half-timbered house with oriel windows and throws a pitcher of cold water at a man on his doorstep.
The caption reads in the original French: Une bonne potée d’eau froide.

caption: Wollaton Hall, Nottinghamshire.
description: Wollaton Hall is a country house in Nottingham built at the end of the sixteenth century for Francis Willoughby, a coalowner.

caption:
Faire virgin, to redeem her deare,
Brings Arthur to the fight:
Who slays the Gyaunt, wounds the beast,
And strips Duessa quight.
description: An armored knight armed with a sword fights a bearded giant whose club has just missed him, leaving deep cracks in the ground.

caption:
The guilefull great Enchaunter parts
The Redcross knight from Truth:
Into whose stead faire Falshood steps,
And workes him woefull ruth.
description: A woman is sitting under a tree in the lush grass as a knight in armor is kneeling beside her busy with a branch.

caption:
The Redcrosse knight is captive made
by Gyaunt proud opprest,
Prince Arthur meets with Una great-
Ly with those news distrest.
description: A knight on a horse leans towards the woman talking to him.

caption:
This corpulent lunatic cried
“By gravy, I’m going to slide”
But he slipt and he fell
And his friends couldn’t tell
Where he went to though vainly they tried.
description: A plump man tries to steady himself and resist the wind that took away his hat and threatens to take him away too.

caption:
Forsaken Truth long seeks her love,
and makes the Lyon mylde;
Marres blind Devotions mart, & fals
In hand of leachour vylde.
description: A woman accompanied by a lion stands at the door of a house and waves at the grieving people inside.

caption: The wood-wain.
description: A wood wain is in a clearing with its load of tree-trunks and seems to be getting ready to go. A man is standing on top, in a good position to make sure everything is in place. Horses are waiting, and props holding the trunks have yet to be removed.

caption: The glee in three voices.
description: A group of five musicians is singing and playing the flute, lute, and drum.

caption:
This wolf of this shepherd boy said
“I will quiet him now till he’s dead”
But a high note occurred
And when it was heard
The wolf dropped the subject and fled.
description: A shepherd boy plays the flute leaning back against a large stone. He didn’t notice the wolf sneaking up behind him, ready to pounce.

caption: The worthy knight, John Carewe.
description: An armored knight riding a white horse is surrounded by monks at the porch of a monastery, or church.

caption: The king’s huntsman.
description: Two men in sixteenth century clothes are taking part in a deer hunt accompanied by their dogs. One is blowing a horn while the other, armed with a bow, watches the deer run away.

caption: Royal hunting in France.
description: A man on a horse and two others afoot fight a wild boar with spears and dogs.

caption: The royal introduction.
description: A party of at least three people on horses is on a hunting excursion. They are accompanied by a hound master and have stopped moving as they watch two birds in the sky.

caption: Under the moonbeams.
description: View of a pond or river at night with trees lining a bank and a meadow in the background where sheep are asleep.

caption: The ferry-boat.
description: Level landscape with a majestic tree. In the foreground people and animals are crossing a river in a punt poled by a man wearing a cap.

caption: The market-cart.
description: On a sunken lane, a small herd of sheep is on its way to the market, followed by a cart carrying two people and a variety of goods.

caption: The old chair-mender at the cottage door.
description: A chair mender is at work by the gate of a thatched cottage as a woman and her children are on their way out.

caption:
In the vast forest here,
Clad in my warlike gear,
Fell I upon my spear
description: A Viking warrior stands by a tree, looking thoughtful and grieving. He is leaning on his spear, which he holds with both hands.

caption: The farm-yard.
description: A farm-yard with sheds, a few cows, a small pond with ducks, and a water pump.

caption:
Mid-ships with iron keel
Struck we her ribs of steel.
description: At the end of a naval fight between two drekkars one is sinking while the other stays afloat.

caption: The wind-mill.
description: View of a windmill standing in the open countryside with a pond in the foreground.

caption: The watering-place.
description: Night landscape showing a creek on a rocky seafront with small fishing boats in the foreground and houses on top of a small cliff further away.

caption: The dipping place.
description: A woman fills a jug at a pond surrounded by luxuriant vegetation at a thatched cottage.

caption:
Cloud-like we saw the shore
Stretching to leeward.
description: A Viking warrior is sitting at the bow of a longship, holding a spear and his fiancée.

caption: At sunset.
description: View of a large pond with a village behind it, partly hidden by a clump of trees. A woman with her child can be seen walking on the bank.

caption:
I wooed the blue-eyed maid,
Yielding, yet half afraid,
And in the forest’s shade
Our vows were plighted.
description: A Viking and his sweetheart are having a decisive walk in the woods.

caption:
Wild was the life we led;
Many the souls that sped,
Many the hearts that bled,
By our stern orders
description: A group of women grieve over the body of a dead or dying man lying on a flat rock by the sea. People are seated around a fire burning in the background.

caption: The nurse and the wolf.
description: A female monkey dressed in human clothes sits on the floor of a poor home, holding a youngster in her arms. A wolf pokes his head in at the window.

caption:
Should not the dove so white
Follow the sea-mew’s flight?
description: A Viking warrior has drawn his sword and is assuming a protective posture to allow his fiancée to take refuge in his arms.

caption:
The other was a softer voice
As soft as honey dew.
description: A half-unconscious man is on the deck of a ship, his body slumped against the ship’s rail, as two angel-like figures coming from the open sea look him over.

caption:
Ah, well-a-day! What evil looks
Had I from old and young
Instead of the cross the albatross
About my neck was hung.
description: A man is kneeling on the deck of a boat with a dead albatross, its wings spread, hanging from his neck.

caption:
Many a wassail-bout
Wore the long winter out.
description: A group of Vikings indulging in libations around a large table.

caption:
While the brown ale he quaffed,
Loud then the champion laughed.
description: A stout, bearded, and somewhat fierce-looking man is sitting on a throne. He holds on to a drinking horn with one hand and his daughter with the other.

caption: Part III.
description: A man leaning on a ship’s rail gazes at the glassy sea in the sunset as another ship can be seen on the horizon. Headpiece for part III.
A man is on the beach, with one knee to the ground, ready to shoot an arrow toward the open sea. His wife and their child stand beside him.

caption:
He went like one that hath been stunned
And is of sense forlorn.
description: A man in sixteenth-century clothes stands in a gateway, wide-eyed and with a bewildered look on his face. He has one hand to his head as though to stop it from spinning.

caption:
On the white sea-strand,
Waving his armed hand,
Saw we old Hildebrand,
With twenty horsemen.
description: A group of Vikings riding horses appears on a beach surrounded by rocks, where they have to stop pursuing the fugitives they were chasing.

caption: Sports.
description:
Sports are represented in a series of drawings showing a group of men in military attire marching in the country, women in a gymnasium sitting on a swing or lifting weights, a horse’s head, and a bicycle.
The title reads in the original French: Les sports.
Various techniques were used in this book to reproduce the original illustrations by Paul Avril, including heliogravure and chromotypographic processes.

caption: The travelers and the bear.
description: A bear takes a close look at man lying motionless on the ground as a second man has taken refuge in one of the two trees which frame the page.

caption: But he got down on t'other side.
description: A man is seen from above hanging by his fingertips from the edge of a roof while the city is visible behind him with its narrow streets and oriel windows.

caption: Californian turkey vulture.
description:
A male California condor (Gymnogyps californianus) is seen perched on a large branch with its neck stooped forward. This bird is listed as Californian vulture (Cathartes californianus, Lath.) by the author, whose description begins as follows:
Of the three species of Vulture which inhabit the southern parts of North America, this is so much superior in size to the rest that it bears to them the same proportion as a Golden Eagle to a Goshawk. It inhabits the valleys and plains of the western slope of the continent, and has not been observed to the eastward of the Rocky Mountains.

caption: The major's clock.
description: A young man makes a show of his astonishment upon being shown a sophisticated clock, to the mild embarrassment of his party.

caption: Annamese tirailleur.
description:
Annamese tirailleur (Vietnamese: Linh Tâp) walking with his upper body leaning slightly forward. His rifle is resting on his right shoulder and his face is turned towards the viewer.
France founded the colony of Cochin China in 1865. The first Annamese infantry regiment was created in 1879. Primarily composed of two battalions, a third one was added  in 1885. These infantrymen mainly had an auxiliary role.
The caption reads in the original French: Tirailleur annamite.

caption: The Dodo solemnly presented the thimble.
description: The Dodo seen in profile view holds a thimble between two remiges and gives it to an open-mouthed Alice as other animals witness the scene.

caption:
T is for Talleyrand toasting Miss Truth,
By the side of her well, in a glass of vermouth,
And presenting Mark Twain as the friend of his youth.
description: Truth is represented as a woman coming out of a well and greeted by two men (Talleyrand and Mark Twain) bowing to her with glasses in their hands.

caption: The heron.
description: Gray heron (Ardea cinerea) seen fishing on a shore with an eel in its bill. The gray heron is a large wading bird in the family Ardeidae. It can be found throughout the temperate regions of Europe and Asia where it feeds on fish, frogs, and other aquatic animals.

caption: The Scott rotary web printing press.
description:
Perspective view of the Scott rotary web press, manufactured by Messrs. C. Potter, Jr., & Co., of New York. It is described as follows by the author:
A double-width press of this kind has printed and folded with two folds 30,000 small folio newspapers an hour. The roll of paper is placed so that it slides into position easily without rising up. The folding is done by rotary creasers; as the knife revolves and cuts off the sheets, the creasers revolve and fold them. The sheets are printed, cut, and receive the primary folds without the use of tapes or belts.

caption:
All light and white as a fleecy cloud
A female form floats gracefully.
description: A man rides on horseback through a forest overlooked by a castle on a hill as a female figures floats high above him below the treetops.

caption: Adam's house.
description:
View of the entrance of a street lined with tall timber-framed houses as a horse can be seen pulling a cartload of stones. Adam’s house stands on the right of the pîcture.
The caption reads in the original French: La maison d’Adam.

caption: A spring day in the life of insects.
description:
A spring day in the life of insects: various species of bees are foraging on catkins among budding branches.
The caption reads in the original German: Frühlingsbild aus dem Insektenleben.

caption: Title page illustration from Aventures de Robert-Robert et de son fidèle compagnon Toussaint Lavenette.
description: Title page illustration from Aventures de Robert-Robert et de son fidèle compagnon Toussaint Lavenette featuring the portraits of the two main characters on medallions.

caption: Roger is introduced and enslaved.
description: A man is introduced to a woman at a ball.

caption: Insect mimicry.
description:
By a tree in the meadows, insects are almost invisible by naturally blending into their surroundings by their shapes and colors.
The caption reads in the original German: Mimikry (Schutzähnlichkeit) der Insekten.

caption: Tu t'en repentiras, Colin.
description:
A man stands beside a woman ready to turn the leaves of her music as she plays the piano.
The caption reads: “You’ll be sorry, Colin.”

caption: A love letter.
description: A young woman hands a letter to a man in top hat standing in a doorway.

caption: Unwelcome attentions.
description: A man comes to join two women sitting in front of a fireplace.

caption: A swarm of locusts.
description:
A dense swarm of green-headed locusts fills the horizon, as a farmer and his family make pathetic efforts to drive them away. In the foreground, some are seen in more detail feeding on wheat.
The caption reads in the original German: Schwarm der Wanderheuschrecke.

caption: Damselfly laying eggs.
description:
A pond, lush with aquatic plants and live with damselflies at various stages of development.
The caption reads in the original German: Eierlengende Schlankjungfer.

caption: Exotic butterflies.
description:
Colorful butterflies are flying around on a background of flowers and branches. The depicted species are named as follows, from top to bottom and from left to right, with the current designations in parentheses:
The caption reads in the original German: Ausländische Tagfalter.

caption: Vae victis!
description: A woman sitting on a porch with a book in her lap watches two men engaged in a conversation walk by.

caption: A struggle with birds.
description:
Two men in a mangrove-like landscape are battling against a flock of parrots which forces one of them to dive into the water.
The caption reads in the original French: Une bataille avec les oiseaux.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
He is cast into a net by his own feet, and walketh upon a snare.
—Job XVIII. 8.
description:
Book the Second. Emblem III. A Cupid-like figure pulls on a fishing net in which a fish with a human jester’s head is caught. On a scroll unfolding among the ornaments is the motto Non amat iste sed hamat amor.
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
Oh Lord, thou knowest my foolishness, and my sins are not hid from thee.
—Psalm LXIX. 5.
description:
Book the Third. Emblem II. A child in a jester’s hat and doublet rides a globe with an ass’s head.
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
Be thou faithful unto death, and I will give thee a crown of life.
—Rev. II. 10.
description:
Illustration for the last emblem. A winged cherub takes off toward the sky as a leafless tree shaped as a skull stands in the foreground. At the bottom of the illustration, among the ornaments, is the motto Fidesque coronat ad aras.
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, that I dwell in the tents of Kedar!
—Psalm CXX. 5.
description:
Book the Fifth. Emblem VII. A snail with a human face and a cone-shaped hat points his tentacles to his left.
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
Then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin; and sin, when it is finished, bringeth forth death.
—James I. 15.
description:
Book the First. Emblem II. Heads of various species of animals stick out from a globe. A cat, a pig, a peacock, a dog or a wolf are easy to recognize, whereas the head in the center is only vaguely human. A scroll in the decoration bears the motto Sic malum crevit unicum in omne malum.
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
What will ye do in the day of your visitation, to whom will ye flee for help? and where will ye leave your glory?
—Isaiah X. 3.
description:
Book the Second. Emblem IV. A creature with a child’s body, an owl-like face, and the wings of a bat rises from a spherical mushroom. In the decoration is the motto Venturum exhorresco diem (I fear the light of the coming day).
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.
—Psalm CXIX. 120.
description:
Book the Fourth. Emblem IV. A creature with a child’s body and a beastly face wields lightning bolts under a stormy sky.
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.
—Luke VI. 25.
description:
Book the First. Emblem VIII. A skeleton in a jester’s outfit stands by a freshly dug grave and lifts a laughing mask from his face, unveiling his grimacing skull. A scroll in the decoration bears the motto Et risu necat (and laughter kills).
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
Every man is tempted, when he is drawn away by his own lust, and enticed.
—James I. 14.
description:
A snake is coiled around a large stylized heart and holds an apple in its mouth. Below the picture two separate scrolls bear the inscription Totus mundus in maligno/Mali ligno positus est, which stands for Totus mundus in maligno positus est (The whole world is established inside the Devil).
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption: Frontispiece.
description:
The globe, in the guise of a peacock, stands on a skull that a jester starts chiseling with a mischievous smile.
One possible interpretation of these symbols is that the world, vain as it is, doesn’t stand on any firmer ground than its own mortality, and folly is hard at work to hasten its fall.

artist_name: Bennett, Charles Henry, Rogers, William Harry
caption:
Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity.
—Psalm CXIX. 37.
description:
Book the Fourth. Emblem V. A child in jester’s clothes is busy playing with soap bubbles, a fan, and a peacock feather while his feet are tied together.
For this series of illustrations, the main figurative artwork was carried out by Charles Henry Bennett and the ornamental part by William Harry Rogers.

caption: The owl and the grasshopper.
description: The grasshopper comes to the sleeping owl singing and playing the guitar.

caption: The mountain in labour.
description: A group of astrologers is pointing a battery of telescopes at a mountain top.

caption: The ass and the lion hunting.
description: A cohort of many different animals is gathered in a valley surrounded by mountains, where a lion pouncing on a horse seems to stir the greatest agitation. An ass can be seen in the distance braying on a high rock.

caption: The wolf and the mastiff.
description: A dog and a wolf face each other at night by a tree with a large full moon in the background.

caption: The wolf and the crane.
description: A wolf has walked into the shop of an apothecary, which looks like an alchemist’s den. Holding a handkerchief to the side of his head and showing his mouth, he asks the crane with his long pointed bill to help him.

caption: The bear and the beehive.
description: A bear is running away in a panic from the furious bees chasing him.

caption: The lion and the mouse.
description: A lion is caught in a net, his mane disheveled, and looks at the mouse next to him.

caption: The fox and the boar.
description: A wild boar rubs his tusks on the bark of a large tree as a fox carrying a dead rabbit on a stick stops to talk to him.

caption: Loss of  the clipper ship Dunbar near Sydney.
description:
The only survivor of the English ship Dunbar is being rescued. The Dunbar ran aground in the night of August 20, 1857.
The caption reads in the original French: Perte du clipper Dunbar près de Sydney.

caption: Mercury and the woodman.
description: A ghost-like figure rises from the swamp holding an ax in front of a bewildered woodman.

caption: The frogs desiring a king.
description: A stork is sitting on the bank of a pond busy eating frogs. More frogs are swarming at his feet and seem unsure whether to come to him or leap away.

caption: The eagle and the fox.
description: A mother eagle and her offspring are about to feast on a young fox.

caption: The cock and the fox.
description: A rooster perched high on a dead tree looks down at the fox talking to him.

caption:
But go there, lonely,
At eventide,
And hearken, hearken
To the lisping tide
description: A man stands alone on a beach in an vigilant posture under the darkening sky.

caption: I met many large fish, who were, if I could judge by their open mouths, not only able, but really wished to devour us.
description:
A man riding his horse under the sea is surrounded by gigantic fish willing to devour him.
